elements.text: PART ONE
THEME
1. INT. ROYAL NURSERY (GADAREL PALACE
TINKLING WIND-CHIMES, MUSIC BOX PLAYING
Have a care, little Cheni. The chimes are pretty... but they have sharp edges.
A BABY STARTS TO SOB.
Now you’ve cut yourself. Poor little mite, let me clean it for you. Hush now. Hush. Shall I tell you a story? Shall I tell you a tale of bravery, love and loss?
BABY SNIFFLES.
That’s right. The romance of Kylo and Aliona. It’s your favourite, isn’t it?
THE BABY’S GURGLING WITH PLEASURE AGAIN.

Then I’1l begin. Once upon a shining star, not so long ago, there lived a courageous Knight of Sorsha, the noble Prince Kylo. And Prince Kylo loved with all his heart a pure and beauteous maiden named Aliona. She was a Princess of House Gadarel. And do you know what else she was?
BABY GIGGLES.
That’s right, my little Empress...
THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 4
2. INT. OBSERVATION DECK (STARCRUISER
(CATHEDRAL-LIKE DIMENSIONS, METAL DECKS. THE THRUM OF
POWERFUL ENGINES. )
.Sshe waS your cousin.
THE V.O. FADES LIKE A DREAM. A LIFT-DOOR SWOOSHES OPEN.
Ah... begging your pardon, Empress Cheni...
Hmm? Oh, it’s Dukhin, isn’t it? Won’t you join me, Dukhin Stubbs? We can watch the stars drift by together.
Er... aS you wish, Ma’am. (HE APPROACHES) Very, er... nice.
I don’t suppose you visit the Observation Deck very often. You have more important things to do, I imagine.
Um, yes. Usually. (BEAT) Unless... unless you’d like me to. In which case, I'd love to. Watch the stars drift by, I mean. Nothing better.
CHENI LAUGHS — WARMLY, NOT SNEERING.
No, that’s quite all right, Dukhin. Although I do recommend it. So very peaceful. (GENTLY) You must have come here for a reason. Did Vincol send you?
Er, yes, he did, he wanted me to tell you we’re three hours from planetfall.
Really? Then that planet... there must be our destination, is that right?
Er, yes, I believe that is Cawdor, yes. Although I’m not exactly an expert...
You surprise me.
THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 5
I do, Imperial Highness?
No, not Highness. Qatreem. I’m not your Empress on this trip, I’m Qatreem Voss. I type sixty-five words a minute and brew excellent tea.
Of course.
Final negotiations are important, but I never get to see them properly, I always put everyone on edge. This way I get to have a presence without having a presence.
Yes, Ma’am. Not Ma’am, I mean, what do I mean...
I’ve no idea. Look, don’t worry about it. Tell Vincol I’11 be up soon. Just a few more minutes alone with the galaxy.
Right.
You should probably keep up the honorifics with him. I imagine
he’s the sort who rather likes them.
(STIFFLING A SNIGGER) Yes, Ma’... (COUGHS) Qatreem.
HE MARCHES BACK TO THE LIFT.
THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 6
3. INT. WRATH FLAGSHIP
(BUILT FROM COMPONENTS NEVER MEANT TO FIT TOGETHER. INDUSTRIAL
METAL SCREECHES ON METAL, GEARS GRIND, STEAM HISSES.
VOICES, LIKE A RECORDING IN A CROWDED ROOM. THE ‘WRATH’
ARE A GESTALT MIND, EACH LINKED TO THE GREATER WHOLE. THIS
BUZZ ALWAYS ACCOMPANIES THEM. )
Course plotted Lord Deliverer Tenebris.
(HOARSE, CROAKING) How long to our destination?
Arrival at target: thirteen hours.
The Pulse batteries?
Charging.
Inform me when we’re in range. I shall be in the Pulse Chamber.
Tenebris be praised.
So close now, to the Empire’s heart.
HE LEAVES AS CONTROLS ARE MANIPULATED
THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 7
4. EXT. BLASTED HEATH (CAWDOR
(BLEAK. BARREN. LOW, WHISTLING BREEZE. THE TARDIS MATERIALISES. THE DOCTOR EMERGES. )
What? That looks like the Valloreides Constellation. Strange...
SOMETHING HISSES. ACCOMPANIED BY LOTS OF SLITHERING.
(OBLIVIOUS) Surely it can’t be Valloreides. That’s light-years away from Gadarel Prime. I programmed the TARDIS precisely...
MORE SLITHERING - APPROACHING.
You’ve not been rebelling against me again have you old girl? I know the last time we were in this sector you weren’t exactly treated agreeably, but -
SLITHERING — AND SNAPPING TEETH!
Ow! Saw-Toothed Dremareels! Ow! My blessed bones! Why did it have to be Dremareels?
THE SNAKE-LIKE DREMAREELS ATTACK
Ah. Stay back! Ouch! Get off me!
MANY HOOVES APPROACHING.
Crossbows! Fire!
(CROSSBOWS TWANG! A DREMAREEL IS SKEWERED, IT SHRIEKS! THE
SLITHER AWAY. THE HORSES STOP. THE DOCTOR BRUSHES
DOWN. )
Ah, thank you, sir. I had those Dremareels on the run, of course, but I’m always grateful for a little help.
A RIDER DISMOUNTS, MEDIEVAL ARMOUR CLANKING.
Who are you?
THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 8
A stranger. Just visiting this charming planet of yours. Which charming planet would that be, incidentally?
Don’t try to deceive me, outworlder. This is Cawdor — as you well know. (TO HIS MEN) Bind his wrists, clan-brothers! We’1l take him back with us. He may be worth something.
What? But - now, just wait a [moment] —
THUMP! THE DOCTOR'S KNOCKED UNCONSCIOUS.
THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 9
5. EXT. NOMAD CAMP (CAWDOR
CAMPFIRE CRACKLING. HORSES ARRIVE. NOMADS DISMOUNT.
Woah. Right, put the prisoner down carefully. We want him in good shape, for the ransom —
OLERIK STOMPS TO MEET HIM.
What’s this? Out all night then when you roll up you’ve another flamin’ mouth to feed. (SPITS INTO THE FIRE) What’ve you dragged home this time?
An outworlder, mother of my brood.
An outworlder? Don’t look like any outworlder I’ve ever seen.
If not for me, those Dremareels would be feasting on his guts this very moment.
Which would have been bad because..?
He may be of value.
‘Maybe’? Maybe? Maybe ain’t good enough, Athrid. Let’s kill him and take his stuff. Not the coat, obviously.
He lives til I say, woman. This is my clan, you obey me. He’s worth more to us alive than dead.
(SNORTS) Fine. Okay. He lives. What’s your ingenious scheme then, father of my brood. We’re all dying to hear it.
You know the way of the outworlders, Olerik. The life of a comrade’s worth more to them than a dozen storbuck calves. They'll pay a fat ransom for this one’s return.
Really?
THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 10
Aye.
Take his gag off.
THE DOCTOR SPLUTTERS AS IT’S REMOVED.
Ah, why thank you madam. So glad someone around here can be reasonable. Perhaps if you could untie me, I could -
Shut up.
(SIGHS) Right you are. So no-one around here can be reasonable.
Where’s he from?
Where’s he - ? What are you talking about, woman? I told you. He’s an outworlder.
Don’t be soft, Athrid. Ain’t you got it yet? Not all outworlders are the same. If he’s some random bloke, he ain’t going to be worth a thing to us. We should just do him in now.

What? Er, Madam, you’re quite right to say we offworlders come in a wide variety of guises. A good point, well made. But let me reassure you that in this particular case I am indeed one of those you seek.
You are?
Oh, absolutely, yes. Indisputably.
Right. And who are these people we seek exactly?
Who are - ? Who are... Well, if you really want me to be specific, I suppose I could — um...
See? Lying. He ain’t from the Empire. Run him through and have done with it...
THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 11
No!
No! I’m taking this man to the castle -
Don’t you ever think? Listen here...
(SHOUTS) LOOK!
(THERE'S A RUMBLE — LIKE THUNDER OR A POWERFUL, DISTANT ENGINE,
UP AND AWAY. THE CHATTER AMONG THE NOMADS RISES! THE
GOES WILD!)
In the heavens! / The fire — as they promised! / It burns like the sun!
My word! A rocket launch?
You see that light burning up into the sky, outworlder? The clans of Cawdor have taken the fire of the gods! Now the stars themselves will tremble!
Cut it out, Athrid. It’s a rocket. No need to get so flamin’ messianic.
Not built on this planet, I assume. I mean, no offence, but you’re positively medieval. I doubt you could manufacture even the simplest interplanetary vessel without assistance.
The rocket’s a gift. From the outworlders.
The clan-lords have been trumpeting about it for weeks, good to see they weren’t talking out of their hats.
A gift?
A reward. To Cawdor for its Galdrium deposits.
THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 12
Ah, Galdrium, yes of course, quite a valuable commodity.
So the outworlders say. And in return, they offer all the tools and knowledge their Empire can provide. A ring of steel in the heavens, and a fiery carriage to bear our bravest there.
You never stop, do you?
Or a space-station and a rocket, to put it less esoterically.
If you like.
And just so we’re all quite clear: which Empire is it again?
Which - ? The Drashani Empire.
(RUEFUL) It seems I’m not so far off course after all.
THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 13
6. INT. PULSE CHAMBER (WRATH FLAGSHIP
(FILLED WITH MIRRORS AND PRISMS. THE GLASS HUMS AND SINGS, LIKE
WINEGLASSES VIBRATING. HIGH ABOVE, POWER SPARKS AND FIZZES. CONSOLE CONTROLS ARE MANIPULATED )
Approaching objective: planet Cawdor.
I’1l assume command. Bring me my mask.
Yes, Lord Deliverer.
(TENEBRIS DONS A FACEMASK. CLIPS AND HOOK FASTEN. HE DRAWS A
BREATHS — RESPIRATION’S EASIER, HIS VOICE NO LONGER RASPS. )
Strike force 30,000 kilometers from target. Pulse batteries forty minutes to optimal charge.
Orbital platform and multistage launch vehicle detected.
What? Cawdor’s a millennium away from that technology.
Additional information: interstellar vessel detected.
A Drashani starcruiser?
Confirmed. Power-source: type four Praxis Valve.
(BEAT) Target the space-station. Frighten the Empire’s bureaucrats into flight, then seize their vessel and take its Praxis Valve. It will be simplicity itself.
As you command, Lord Deliverer Tenebris.
CONTROLS ARE MANIPULATED.
THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 14
7. EXT. COURTYARD (CAWDOR CASTLE
(CASTLE KEEP, DOMAIN OF MERCHANTS, FARMERS, PEASANTS. THE BUSTLE OF TRADING. FARM ANIMALS BLEAT AND CLUCK. )
So this is Cawdor Castle, eh? Your world’s council seat?
Aye.
I can’t imagine you nomads have much to do with cosseted city folk.
They’ve got their uses.
Negotiating with off-world empires, for example?
The outworlders are in here somewhere. I shall find them, collect the ransom and return to my clan.
You want rid of me already? You really know how to flatter a chap, don’t you Athrid?
Eh?
Well, I am nonetheless grateful you got me away from that bloodthirsty wife of yours, I don’t think she had my best interests at heart.
She’s a fine woman.
I’m sure she is, I can’t have seen her best side, she must be terribly charming at dinner parties...
She won’t be happy if I come back empty handed.
And you won’t. If it’s the Gadarel Empire. There’s definitely a diplomatic party here?
THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 15
One of their carriages flew overhead a few hours past. They are here.
To witness the inaugural voyage of their rocket to the space station, I assume. Which would mean they’1l be in the vicinity of mission control. Hmm... Why don’t we try down there?
(SNIFFS) That’s an old crypt.
Yes. But how many old crypts do you know with a wide array of parabolic reflecting aerials on the outside?
Para-what?
Just trust me on this one, will you, there’s a good fellow... I think this is where we’ll find your outworlders.
THEY WALK.
THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 16
8. INT. MISSION-CONTROL CATACOMBS (CAWDOR CASTLE
(BUSTLING EFFICIENCY. CAPE CANAVERAL, 1963 — RELOCATED TO AN
MEDIEVAL CRYPT. )
Attempting docking lock with space-station, Cawdor Control.
Confirmed, Pilum Alpha.
On my mark, Pilum Alpha. Three... two...
APPROACHING FOOTSTEPS.
Who the hell are - ?
Athrid! Clan-father of the Tar’khut! Take me to the outworlders city dweller or you will taste the keen edge of my blade!
SWORD DRAWN FROM SHEATH.
Or maybe not. Athrid — please! Put your sword away! I do apologise for my friend, he skipped breakfast this morning, he’s not in the best of moods.
Cawdor Control? What’s going on?
Hold position, Pilum Alpha. Things are a bit confused down here.

I do apologise for the intrusion. An orbital spaceshot’s Mission-Control, eh? Deep beneath a medieval crypt... you think you’ve seen it all, then something like this comes along! Cawdor ground-crew, trained by Drashani engineers, I presume?
Somebody get these two out of here!
I thought as much. Perhaps you’d be kind enough to inform the imperial delegation of our presence?
Now listen, I’m Mission Controller Boritz, and I -
THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 17
I will be welcome, I assure you.
I’m calling security...
Doctor, you said —
Oh, if I must. Perhaps this will ease my passage...
(HE FUMBLES IN HIS POCKETS, PULLS SOMETHING OUT. PERHAPS A
SOUND EFFECT, JEWELLERY GLISTENING? )
(GASPS) It’s beautiful!
What’s - ?
The Royal Carcanet of the Drashani Empire, centrepiece of Aliona’s wedding jewellery. If you could tell the Drashani I have it, it might prove conducive.
You had that on you all the time? Dammit, Olerik was right, I should’ve robbed you and left you to the Dremareels.
BEAT
Shall I contact Chief Advocate Vincol, sir?
Yes. This is above my pay grade.
THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 18
9. INT. VINCOL’S CHAMBERS (CAWDOR CASTLE) — DAY
CORK POPS
More wine, Advocate?
Please.
SHE POURS
Doctor?
No thank you. You know, you look rather familiar to me, have we met?
I don’t think so. Wine, Mr Athrid?
Wine? The drink of effete scribblers, woman. A real man drinks ale. Vast foaming flagons of ale!
That’s a no then is it?
(BEAT) Actually, I will have another, this isn’t half bad. Particularly when served by such a dainty wench. Ha!
Oh, er... thank you...
SHE POURS
Really, does this... thing have to be here all the time?
Oh, apologies, Advocate Vincol. My, er, acquaintance isn’t used to high society. I’d say he’s barely aware of low society.
Well, seeing as he’s at least partially responsible for the return of the Carcanet I suppose I can extend to him some hospitality. Tradition dictates its bearer be afforded all honour and respect.
THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 19
Good.
Then I’m glad I brought it.
It’s so beautiful. Poor Aliona must have looked an angel when she wore it.
(UNCONVINCED) If you say so. Vincol, the nomads tell me you’re negotiating with Cawdor’s Council for minerals. Galdrium, in particular. Is this true?
We're offering a fair price. Exclusive mining rights in return for advanced technology and Imperial protection.
Keep your protection, we’ll settle for your toys and trinkets.
I imagine negotiations are going to fly by.
We've gifted them the space-station, and the rocket. We’ve been training their astronauts and engineers for several months. They’re progressing centuries in the tiniest amount of time.
I know. And I’m not entirely sure I’m happy about that. Who’s ruling the Empire these days?
(BEAT) Her most Royal Empress Cheni Gadarel.
Cheni Gadarel? Tuvold’s daughter?
Tuvold?
Er, yes, she was crowned three decades ago. When she was little more than a baby.
So I’m here thirty years later than I’d intended. Could be worse.
ATHRID GLUGS HIS WINE, SLAMS DOWN HIS GOBLET.
THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 20
More wine, girl!
(HE SWATS CHENI’S BEHIND. SHE YELPS. HER TRAY CRASHES, GLASS SHATTERS! )
Clumsy wench!
HE GRABS HER. SHE STRUGGLES.
How dare -! Get off me! Vincol!
What? Keep your hands off her. Qatreem Voss is my personal assistant!
Vincol! Help me!
Ha! See her struggle!
(CHENI THRASHES. VINCOL GETS VERY GARY COOPER. DRAWS A BLADE,
FIZZES AND CRACKLES WITH LETHAL ELECTRICITY. )
Release her. Or my meson-bodkin will burn out your heart.
Are you mad? You’d go to war for a scivvy? Pity you’re about to die, outworlder, you’ve grit, I might’ve liked you.
THEIR BLADES TAP. THINGS ARE ABOUT TO KICK OFF.
Let’s all relax shall we? There are times I feel I’m the only civilised being left in this scruffy galaxy! Athrid, put the young lady down and apologise.
Hmmmph .
He told you to apologise, barbarian!
That appears to be an electrical dagger, Athrid, retreat might be advantageous.
THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003)
(BEAT) Very well. I apologise.
HE RELEASES HER
I should run you through for this!
Vincol, Vincol, it’s alright. I’m not hurt.
But Qatreem —
(INSISTENT) I’m alright.
As you wish. (RESHEATHES HIS BLADE) Though perhaps
wise if you left us?
Thank you, Vincol, but I’1l stay.
If you insist.
Page 21
Bt
would be
(SLIGHTLY PUZZLED) Yes. Well, as long as we’re all where we
should be. Vincol. Tell me more of Cheni Gadarel.
THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 22
10. INT. MISSION-CONTROL CATACOMBS (CAWDOR CASTLE
Crew transfer complete. All astronauts aboard Space-Station V- 24. All systems reading top of the line.
GROUND-CONTROL TEAM CHEER!
Mission accomplished! Great work everybody! Say what you like about the Drashani — when it comes to hardware, they know their
Wait.
What?
Got a new reading. Some kind of energy pulse...
THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 23
11. INT. VINCOL’S CHAMBERS (CAWDOR CASTLE
Cheni was crowned during the Succession of Blood.
The Succession of Blood, eh? An evocative epithet for such a messy episode, though undeniably apt. Do continue.
When House Sorsha was wiped out and the heirs lost on Sharnax, the Empire almost tore itself apart in a mass of in-fighting.
Well, yes. I had intended to return rather earlier, but you know how things get in the way.

But too many people wanted peace. They knew Kylo and Aliona had died pursuing that dream and didn’t want to grant the traitors victory. The saboteurs and murderers were rooted out and a truce was signed out of respect for the sacrifice.
Sacrifice? Yes. And so Cheni was made Empress?
She was the sole heir of Gadarel. And she’s ruled ever since. She’s a noble monarch - compassionate and enlightened. The people adore her. But for the war, this would be a Golden Age.
(SOTTO) Your patriotism’s running away with you, Chief Advocate.
Hmmph. She sounds dull.
‘But for the war?’ Forgive my pedantry, Vincol.. but if the clash between the Empire’s Great Houses ended thirty years ago - what war?
(BEAT) I’m really not sure I should be telling you this, Doctor.
Royal Carcanet, remember.
Honour and respect!
THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 24
But you still haven’t explained your ownership of that. The Carcanet was thought lost with the late Princess’ galley many years ago. I’d love to know how it came to be in your possession.
Ah, well, thereby hangs a tale, Chief Advocate, thereby hangs a tale. Sorry to say, I was present at the tragedy of Sharnax.
But we thought everyone was lost, both on the galley and the rescue ship.

Indeed they were. Brave men and women all. I was the sole survivor. Before I departed, the late Ambassador Tuvold told me to take the Carcanet as a Royal Warranty. For when I stopped by the Empire again.
You knew Tuvold?
Not well. Our companionship was regretfully brief. A fine man nonetheless, with great courage. He did a lot for peace that day, I promise you that.
He - ?
(SHUSHING, LIGHTLY) Qatreem! Er, Doctor, as I say it is traditional the bearer of the Carcanet is afforded respect and honour within the Empire.
Excellent.
But the Succession of Blood has long been a mystery to our people.
Really? But Tuvold said there’d be recordings on the shuttle. A black box of some sort —
Nothing was recovered. The ship’s recorder was damaged by fire.
THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 25
Ah. Well, that would make sense, I suppose.
House Sorsha destroyed, House Gadarel triumphant, the heirs on both sides dead and the Carcanet missing. Now you tell me you were present when it occurred.
Yes, I can see how that could be misinterpreted.
How can I be certain you didn’t murder Kylo and Aliona then take her jewellery as payment?
What, and hang on to it for thirty years before turning up and waving it around at an inopportune moment? Oh, don’t be ridiculous Vincol, think about it! I can explain.
You’d better.
DUKHIN BURSTS IN - BREATHLESS.
Chief Advocate!
(STARTLED) Dukhin?
May I introduce Dukhin Stubbs? One of my delegation’s Junior Consuls. (POINTED) A very Junior Consul. What are you -
Sorry to intrude, Advocate. There’s a problem.
What kind of problem?
I’ve come from Mission-Control. Something’s happening to the space-station!
THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 26
12. INT. MISSION-CONTROL CATACOMBS (CAWDOR CASTLE
(TENSION’S HIGH. AN ELECTRONIC BACKGROUND HOWL, INCREASING IN PITCH. )
Space-Station V-24? Can you hear me? What’s happening up there?
Garvik here, Control! It’s on all our instruments, we can’t block the signal! Barzil and Tregol are down. You’ve gotta help!
THE DOCTOR AND THE DRASHANI DIPLOMATS BARREL IN.
Sorry we’re late. What have we missed?
Something’s attacking the space-station.
We thought it was a natural phenomenon at first. But it looks like an energy beam.
An energy beam? Advocate, do you think it’s - ?
(URGENT) Quiet, Dukhin!
Whatever it is, it’s affecting the crew. Five of them are down, we've no idea if they’re unconscious or dead.
You seem to know what you’re doing, young lady. What’s your name?
Teesha.
Good to meet you, Teesha, let’s have a look at your readings.
(THE ELECTRONIC HOWL STEPS UP A NOTCH. EAR-PIERCING! THE DOCTOR
CONTROLS. )
This equipment’s a bit primitive, isn’t it? Are you measuring radionuclides? Ah, here we are. (BEAT, THEN HORRIFIED) Oh.
THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 27
Get us out of here!
Can you save them? What do we do?
I’m sorry.
We can’t just let them die!
It’s too late. This radiation’s like nothing I’ve ever seen. Your astronauts are already lost.
Control! Help us! Please!
(THE ELECTRONIC HOWL INTENSFIES AGAIN. THE ASTRONAUT SCREAMS,
HORRIBLY. THEN HIS SCREAM STOPS DEAD. THE ELECTRONIC
CUTS OFF TOO. THERE’S A MOMENT OF SILENCE. )
What was that? Someone, anyone - what just happened?

I don’t know. Whatever this beam is, it’s remarkably strong. (GASPS) It’s causing a temporal backwash! No wonder I didn’t land where I expected to. This thing’s powerful enough to knock my ship thirty years and seventy parsecs off course.
(QUIET) And kill a dozen men.
That too, yes.
(DEEP BREATH) Chief Advocate Vincol — on behalf of Cawdor’s High Council, I formally call upon the Drashani Empire to meet its treaty commitments and offer the protection you pledged our world.
The - ? I’m sorry. That won’t be possible. The treaty’s revoked.
What? Sir! We can’t [just] —
THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 28
That thing’s wiped out everyone on the space-station. Who knows what’s next?
You have my sympathies, but it’s not our concern. Dukhin, find Qatreem - get her to the landing-site. We need to be in the warpstream, and heading for Gadarel Prime within the hour.
You treacherous -
We choose our battles, Mission-Controller. I’m sorry. If you knew what we know, you’d do the same. Take my guards, Dukhin. Keep Qatreem safe.
Sir!
DUKHIN HURRIES AWAY. STOPS, JUST BEFORE HE EXITS.
We should tell them what they’re facing, sir.
HE'S GONE.
What did he mean by that?
Excuse me.
HE LEAVES
THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 29
13. INT. CATACOMBS CORRIDOR (CAWDOR CASTLE
VINCOL WALKS. THE DOCTOR HURRIES TO CATCH UP.
Advocate Vincol? What is it you’re not telling me?
I’m busy, Doctor. I must supervise my delegation’s departure.
THE DOCTOR CATCHES UP. THEY WALK TOGETHER.
Whatever happened in orbit’s rattled you. Dukhin was about to say something back there. You stopped him. Why?
It doesn’t matter. It wouldn’t make any difference now. Excuse me.
He’s afraid, Doctor. So am I. So’s every Drashani on Cawdor.
I told you to escort Qatreem to the shuttle, Dukhin.
She’s safe. On her way to the landing-site with a contingent of Archers. You should tell him about the Wrath, sir.
The Wrath? Singular or plural? Abstract or concrete noun?
One more word, Consul, I’1ll maroon you on this planet!
The Wrath are at war with us, Doctor. They want our Empire eradicated from the cosmos.
Dukhin — get back to the shuttle! I’1l deal with you later.
No sir.
No?
They have to know what’s happening. If I can’t tell them while you’re here, I’1l have to stay behind when you’re gone.
THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 30
You’re a junior diplomatic Consul, Dukhin. A nobody. Don’t throw your life away on a gesture.
It’s my decision, sir. Please convey my regrets to Qatreem when you’re clear, I’m sorry I failed her.
You - gah!
VINCOL STOMPS OFF.
That was brave.
Or stupid. Come on. I’11 tell you what I know of the Wrath. And the Acheron Pulse.
THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 31
14. INT. PULSE CHAMBER (WRATH FLAGSHIP
CONTROLS ARE MANIPULATED.
Drashani shuttle leaving Cawdor, Lord Deliverer.
Fleeing to their homeworld. Prepare an attack squadron. Hold until they rendezvous with their starcruiser. Then run them to ground.
Tenebris be praised.
MORE CONTROLS.
THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 32
15. INT. GREAT HALL (CAWDOR CASTLE

DOCTOR: (SLIGHTLY PUZZLED) Yes. Well, as long as we’re all where we
DOCTOR: should be. Vincol. Tell me more of Cheni Gadarel.
DOCTOR WHO: THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 22
TEESHA: Crew transfer complete. All astronauts aboard Space-Station V- 24. All systems reading top of the line.
BORITZ: Mission accomplished! Great work everybody! Say what you like about the Drashani — when it comes to hardware, they know their
TEESHA: Wait.
BORITZ: What?
TEESHA: Got a new reading. Some kind of energy pulse...
DOCTOR WHO: THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 23
VINCOL: Cheni was crowned during the Succession of Blood.
DOCTOR: The Succession of Blood, eh? An evocative epithet for such a messy episode, though undeniably apt. Do continue.
VINCOL: When House Sorsha was wiped out and the heirs lost on Sharnax, the Empire almost tore itself apart in a mass of in-fighting.
DOCTOR: Well, yes. I had intended to return rather earlier, but you know how things get in the way.
VINCOL: But too many people wanted peace. They knew Kylo and Aliona had died pursuing that dream and didn’t want to grant the traitors victory. The saboteurs and murderers were rooted out and a truce was signed out of respect for the sacrifice.
DOCTOR: Sacrifice? Yes. And so Cheni was made Empress?
VINCOL: She was the sole heir of Gadarel. And she’s ruled ever since. She’s a noble monarch - compassionate and enlightened. The people adore her. But for the war, this would be a Golden Age.
CHENT: (SOTTO) Your patriotism’s running away with you, Chief Advocate.
ATHRID: Hmmph. She sounds dull.
DOCTOR: ‘But for the war?’ Forgive my pedantry, Vincol.. but if the clash between the Empire’s Great Houses ended thirty years ago - what war?
VINCOL: (BEAT) I’m really not sure I should be telling you this, Doctor.
DOCTOR: Royal Carcanet, remember.
ATHRID: Honour and respect!
DOCTOR WHO: THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 24
VINCOL: But you still haven’t explained your ownership of that. The Carcanet was thought lost with the late Princess’ galley many years ago. I’d love to know how it came to be in your possession.
DOCTOR: Ah, well, thereby hangs a tale, Chief Advocate, thereby hangs a tale. Sorry to say, I was present at the tragedy of Sharnax.
VINCOL: But we thought everyone was lost, both on the galley and the rescue ship.
DOCTOR: Indeed they were. Brave men and women all. I was the sole survivor. Before I departed, the late Ambassador Tuvold told me to take the Carcanet as a Royal Warranty. For when I stopped by the Empire again.
CHENTI: You knew Tuvold?
DOCTOR: Not well. Our companionship was regretfully brief. A fine man nonetheless, with great courage. He did a lot for peace that day, I promise you that.
CHENI: He - ?
VINCOL: (SHUSHING, LIGHTLY) Qatreem! Er, Doctor, as I say it is traditional the bearer of the Carcanet is afforded respect and honour within the Empire.
DOCTOR: Excellent.
VINCOL: But the Succession of Blood has long been a mystery to our people.
DOCTOR: Really? But Tuvold said there’d be recordings on the shuttle. A black box of some sort —
VINCOL: Nothing was recovered. The ship’s recorder was damaged by fire.
DOCTOR WHO: THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 25
DOCTOR: Ah. Well, that would make sense, I suppose.
VINCOL: House Sorsha destroyed, House Gadarel triumphant, the heirs on both sides dead and the Carcanet missing. Now you tell me you were present when it occurred.
DOCTOR: Yes, I can see how that could be misinterpreted.
VINCOL: How can I be certain you didn’t murder Kylo and Aliona then take her jewellery as payment?
DOCTOR: What, and hang on to it for thirty years before turning up and waving it around at an inopportune moment? Oh, don’t be ridiculous Vincol, think about it! I can explain.
VINCOL: You’d better.
DUKHIN: Chief Advocate!
CHENI: (STARTLED) Dukhin?
VINCOL: May I introduce Dukhin Stubbs? One of my delegation’s Junior Consuls. (POINTED) A very Junior Consul. What are you -
DUKHIN: Sorry to intrude, Advocate. There’s a problem.
DOCTOR: What kind of problem?
DUKHIN: I’ve come from Mission-Control. Something’s happening to the space-station!
DOCTOR WHO: THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 26
DOCTOR WHO: (TENSION’S HIGH. AN ELECTRONIC BACKGROUND HOWL, INCREASING IN PITCH. )
TEESHA: Space-Station V-24? Can you hear me? What’s happening up there?
ASTRONAUT: Garvik here, Control! It’s on all our instruments, we can’t block the signal! Barzil and Tregol are down. You’ve gotta help!
DOCTOR: Sorry we’re late. What have we missed?
BORITZ: Something’s attacking the space-station.
TEESHA: We thought it was a natural phenomenon at first. But it looks like an energy beam.
DUKHIN: An energy beam? Advocate, do you think it’s - ?
VINCOL: (URGENT) Quiet, Dukhin!
TEESHA: Whatever it is, it’s affecting the crew. Five of them are down, we've no idea if they’re unconscious or dead.
DOCTOR: You seem to know what you’re doing, young lady. What’s your name?
TEESHA: Teesha.
DOCTOR: Good to meet you, Teesha, let’s have a look at your readings.
DOCTOR: (THE ELECTRONIC HOWL STEPS UP A NOTCH. EAR-PIERCING! THE DOCTOR
TWIDDLES: CONTROLS. )
DOCTOR: This equipment’s a bit primitive, isn’t it? Are you measuring radionuclides? Ah, here we are. (BEAT, THEN HORRIFIED) Oh.
DOCTOR WHO: THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 27
ASTRONAUT: Get us out of here!
TEESHA: Can you save them? What do we do?
DOCTOR: I’m sorry.
DUKHIN: We can’t just let them die!
DOCTOR: It’s too late. This radiation’s like nothing I’ve ever seen. Your astronauts are already lost.
ASTRONAUT: Control! Help us! Please!
ASTRONAUT: (THE ELECTRONIC HOWL INTENSFIES AGAIN. THE ASTRONAUT SCREAMS,
DISTORTED: HORRIBLY. THEN HIS SCREAM STOPS DEAD. THE ELECTRONIC
HOWL: CUTS OFF TOO. THERE’S A MOMENT OF SILENCE. )
BORITZ: What was that? Someone, anyone - what just happened?
DOCTOR: I don’t know. Whatever this beam is, it’s remarkably strong. (GASPS) It’s causing a temporal backwash! No wonder I didn’t land where I expected to. This thing’s powerful enough to knock my ship thirty years and seventy parsecs off course.
TEESHA: (QUIET) And kill a dozen men.
DOCTOR: That too, yes.
BORITZ: (DEEP BREATH) Chief Advocate Vincol — on behalf of Cawdor’s High Council, I formally call upon the Drashani Empire to meet its treaty commitments and offer the protection you pledged our world.
VINCOL: The - ? I’m sorry. That won’t be possible. The treaty’s revoked.
DUKHIN: What? Sir! We can’t [just] —
DOCTOR WHO: THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 28
BORITZ: That thing’s wiped out everyone on the space-station. Who knows what’s next?
VINCOL: You have my sympathies, but it’s not our concern. Dukhin, find Qatreem - get her to the landing-site. We need to be in the warpstream, and heading for Gadarel Prime within the hour.
BORITZ: You treacherous -
VINCOL: We choose our battles, Mission-Controller. I’m sorry. If you knew what we know, you’d do the same. Take my guards, Dukhin. Keep Qatreem safe.
DUKHIN: Sir!
DUKHIN: We should tell them what they’re facing, sir.
DOCTOR: What did he mean by that?
VINCOL: Excuse me.
DOCTOR WHO: THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 29
DOCTOR: Advocate Vincol? What is it you’re not telling me?
VINCOL: I’m busy, Doctor. I must supervise my delegation’s departure.
DOCTOR: Whatever happened in orbit’s rattled you. Dukhin was about to say something back there. You stopped him. Why?
VINCOL: It doesn’t matter. It wouldn’t make any difference now. Excuse me.
DUKHIN: He’s afraid, Doctor. So am I. So’s every Drashani on Cawdor.
VINCOL: I told you to escort Qatreem to the shuttle, Dukhin.
DUKHIN: She’s safe. On her way to the landing-site with a contingent of Archers. You should tell him about the Wrath, sir.
DOCTOR: The Wrath? Singular or plural? Abstract or concrete noun?
VINCOL: One more word, Consul, I’1ll maroon you on this planet!
DUKHIN: The Wrath are at war with us, Doctor. They want our Empire eradicated from the cosmos.
VINCOL: Dukhin — get back to the shuttle! I’1l deal with you later.
DUKHIN: No sir.
VINCOL: No?
DUKHIN: They have to know what’s happening. If I can’t tell them while you’re here, I’1l have to stay behind when you’re gone.
DOCTOR WHO: THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 30
VINCOL: You’re a junior diplomatic Consul, Dukhin. A nobody. Don’t throw your life away on a gesture.
DUKHIN: It’s my decision, sir. Please convey my regrets to Qatreem when you’re clear, I’m sorry I failed her.
VINCOL: You - gah!
DOCTOR: That was brave.
DUKHIN: Or stupid. Come on. I’11 tell you what I know of the Wrath. And the Acheron Pulse.
DOCTOR WHO: THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 31
WRATH: Drashani shuttle leaving Cawdor, Lord Deliverer.
TENEBRIS: Fleeing to their homeworld. Prepare an attack squadron. Hold until they rendezvous with their starcruiser. Then run them to ground.
WRATH: Tenebris be praised.
DOCTOR WHO: THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 32
DOCTOR: Quiet down everyone! Quiet down! Junior Consul Dukhin has something to say. I’m afraid it isn’t good news.
DUKHIN: Um. Hello everyone.
DOCTOR: Take it slowly, eh? One thing at time. Start with the energy that blasted the space-station.
DUKHIN: Yes... we’ve seen it before. The Drashani Empire, I mean. We call it the Acheron Pulse. It’s a psychic weapon.
ATHRID: A weapon? Cawdor’s under attack?
DUKHIN: The Pulse is controlled by a race we know only as the Wrath. They’re led by a masked warlord — Tenebris. They first struck five years ago, we don’t know where they came from, it’s said they were oppressed and butchered by the Empire. Now they want revenge.
BORITZ: Well, good luck to ‘em. What’s it got to do with us?
DUKHIN: They’re carving through Drashani space, making for our capital. You're in their way.
BORITZ: How can we fight them?
DUKHIN: You can’t. We brought this on you. I’m sorry...
TEESHA: Sorry? You’re sorry?
DOCTOR: That’s enough Dukhin. You can sit down now.
DOCTOR WHO: THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 33
ATHRID: If a storm looms, I must return to my clan. The nomads will gather! We will sing songs of war!
DUKHIN: You'll die. You’1ll all die.
ATHRID: Nonsense! The Tar’khut are the fiercest warriors on —
DOCTOR: - Cawdor. Yes, no doubt you are. But the foe you face isn’t from Cawdor. Dukhin’s right.
BORITZ: What should we do?
DOCTOR: If the Drashani and their technology were still here you might have put up a struggle, but from what I’ve seen your swords and bows are going to be next to useless. I’d advise surrender.
ATHRID: Surrender? Pah! You tremble like a shorn storbuck calf. The wolves of Tar’khut do not yield! (HE GETS UP, KNOCKING OVER HIS CHAIR) While you politicians cower, my clan will prepare for battle! Out of my way!
DOCTOR: I was afraid he’d do that... Boritz, get your mission control team out of here. If the Wrath hate the Drashani as much as Dukhin says, they might be viewed as collaborators and we wouldn’t want that.
BORITZ: Alright.
DOCTOR: But if you and Teesha could stay behind, I’d be terribly grateful, I think I’m going to need all the help I can get.
TEESHA: Understood.
DOCTOR: The rest of you... offer as little resistance as you can, do nothing to provoke them. You’re not their target here, remember that. It’s the only chance we've got.
DOCTOR WHO: THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 34
CHENT: Cawdor’s so tiny from this distance. So vulnerable. You might almost believe it doesn’t matter. Almost.
VINCOL: They might survive, your Highness. If they don’t resist. The Wrath aren’t interested in Cawdor. We’re the ones they hate.
CHENT: Perhaps. But we shouldn’t have abandoned them.
VINCOL: I did what I had to do.
CHENT: Do you know where Dukhin is? I haven’t seen him since we launched.
VINCOL: He chose to remain on Cawdor, your Highness. He asked me to pass on his regrets, I’m afraid it slipped my mind.
CHENT: He stayed? How very noble. Brings to mind the bravery of Kylo himself, don’t you think?
VINCOL: If you say so, Ma’am.
CHENT: What are those lights?
VINCOL: Lights, Ma’am?
CHENT: Those tiny lights, among the stars. They’re getting closer.
VINCOL: Oh no.
DOCTOR WHO: THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 35
BORITZ: How close are the Wrath?
TEESHA: Advance vessels at 30,000 kilometers.
DUKHIN: That’s the range limit of the Acheron Pulse.
DOCTOR: And their troop transports?
TEESHA: Moving in formation. Looks like they’re going to land.
DUKHIN: They’1l occupy the planet. Make Cawdor a staging post for their invasion of the Inner Worlds — taking them less than sixty parsecs from Gadarel Prime.
BORITZ: My heart bleeds for you.
DOCTOR: What are those?
BORITZ: What are what?
TEESHA: I see them. Smaller than the main fleet.
DOCTOR: A squadron of fighters, maybe some boarding pods. They’re on another heading.
TEESHA: They’re after something.
DOCTOR: That single space vessel. There, you see? It’s trying to outrun them, but they’re faster. They’re nearly on it.
DUKHIN: No! It’s the Drashani starcruiser!
DOCTOR WHO: THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 36
DOCTOR WHO: (THE SHIP’S UNDER ATTACK! ENERGY WEAPONS THUD AGAINST THE HULL! A DOOR SWOOSHES OPEN. )
CHENT: Chief Advocate!
VINCOL: We’re under attack, Ma’am. It’s the Wrath. Shields are down to residual power. You’ve got to come with me.
CHENT: We should go the Flight Deck. Be with the crew. They need to know we’re standing [by them] —
VINCOL: Boarding pods, Ma’am! They’ve breached the hull! Come with me!
VINCOL: HURRY!
DOCTOR WHO: THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 37
DUKHIN: We have to help them, Doctor! You’ve a ship, you said?
DOCTOR: Yes.
DUKHIN: We've got to get the diplomatic delegation to safety!
BORITZ: Yeah, right. Save them and forget us!
DUKHIN: You don’t understand. You don’t know why they left.
BORITZ: They’re cowards, that’s why!
DUKHIN: No! The Empire protects its subjects. We’d have laid down our lives for Cawdor!
TEESHA: Well, then why - ?
DUKHIN: Vincol had a higher priority. Our Empress — Cheni Gadarel.
DOCTOR: Cheni? What about her?
DUKHIN: She’s with the delegation — she wanted to attend the negotiations incognito.
DOCTOR: She - ? Of course. Qatreem Voss. Suddenly that altercation with Athrid makes a lot more sense. I thought she looked familiar, it’s a family resemblance, she takes after her cousin!
DUKHIN: Doctor, please!
DOCTOR: Alright.
TEESHA: Doctor?
DOCTOR WHO: THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 38
DOCTOR: I made a promise, Teesha. A vow to a dying man. He wanted me to protect his daughter and I have rather failed in my duty until now. I think I may have to mount a rescue attempt.
BORITZ: A rescue. With just four of us?
DOCTOR: Yes. Is that a problem?
DOCTOR WHO: THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 39
DOCTOR WHO: (VINCOL AND CHENI CLATTER ACROSS THE METALLIC DECK. THERE’S A
FIREFIGHT AROUND THEM: DRASHANI TROOPERS FIRING LASER LONGBOWS — AS IN ‘THE BURNING PRINCE’. EXPLOSIONS! )
VINCOL: (RUNNING) Hurry, Ma’am! Our troops can’t hold the Observation Deck much longer!
CHENT: (RUNNING) I promise... your courage and sacrifice this day will not be forgotten, Advocate Vincol!
VINCOL: (RUNNING) Thank you, Ma’am!
VINCOL: (APPROACHING FOOTSTEPS... MARCHING IN UNISON. THE BUZZ OF THE
WRATH: GESTALT. )
WRATH: This vessel is now under the control of the Wrath. All Drashani forces will surrender.
WRATH: (MORE DRASHANI LASER BOWS. CUT SHORT BY A WRATH FLAMEBOLT!
WRATH: WEAPONS SHOULD IDEALLY SOUND REMINISCENT OF KYLO’S PYROKINESIS IN ‘THE BURNING PRINCE’. )
CHENTI: Emperor’s blood! They’re not even human! What happened to their faces?
VINCOL: This way, Ma’am. When your escape pod’s clear, the Drashani Navy will pick up your signal. They’1ll get you back ho[me] -
VINCOL: (WHUMP! A SECTION OF BULKHEAD CRASHES TO THE DECK, VERY CLOSE. THERE’S A VOLLEY OF WRATH FLAMEBOLTS. VINCOL’S HIT, HE FALLS.)
CHENTI: Vincol!
VINCOL: (IN PAIN) I’m sorry, Ma’am. I failed you.
CHENTI: No! Come on!
CHENT: We’ve got to get out of here, before [they] —
DOCTOR WHO: THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 40
DOCTOR WHO: (THE FIREFIGHT’S OVER; NO MORE LASER BOWS... JUST WRATH FOOTSTEPS IN UNISON. THEIR GESTALT BUZZES. )
VINCOL: (IN PAIN) Too late.
WRATH: Do not move. You are prisoners of the Wrath. If you disobey,
WRATH: you will die.
CHENTI: (AFRAID) Stay away from us! Don’t touch me! Don’t [touch me] —
CLOSING: THEME
DOCTOR WHO: THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 41

elements.text: PART TWO
THEME
21. EXT. COURTYARD (CAWDOR CASTLE) — DAY
(THE CASTLE KEEP. A RESTLESS CROWD. AND THE BUZZ OF THE WRATH’S
MIND. )
(ANNOUNCEMENT) Citizens of Cawdor Castle, we are the Wrath! Your world is now under our control. There is no cause for alarm. Our war is with the Drashani Empire. You are not our enemies.
THE CROWD’S RELIEVED.

We have identified Drashani sympathizers and other insurgents in this courtyard. They will be dealt with. If in proximity to an insurgent, remain calm and divert your gaze. Direct viewing may cause some retinal damage.
THE CROWD’S CONFUSED, UNCERTAIN.
Kill them.
A BARRAGE OF WRATH FLAMEBOLTS! THE CROWD SCREAMS IN TERROR!
THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 42
22. INT. MISSION-CONTROL CATACOMBS (CAWDOR CASTLE) — DAY
CONTROLS ARE MANIPULATED.
There’s Wrath landings all over Cawdor, Doctor. They’re occupying every population centre.
And the attack squadron?
MORE SWITCHES AND DIALS.
It’s moving off. It’s left the Drashani starcruiser for dead.
Map their trajectory. If they’ve taken prisoners we need to find out where they’re going.
I’ll do my best.
SHE OPERATES CONTROLS
I’m glad to see you’re so concerned for the Drashani. Pity you didn’t care when our astronauts were killed and the Wrath landed.
I’m trying to get as many of us through this as I can, Boritz.
You said you made a promise, Doctor - to a dying man?
I did, yes. To Ambassador Tuvold.
Tuvold? Father of the Empress?

It was his last wish. I was to keep an eye on his daughter and the Empire. I’ve been lax in fulfilling my obligations, I had thought to pass by and make amends, but the Acheron Pulse knocked me off course. I’ve arrived a little too late.
I don’t understand. You were there? At the Succession of Blood?
THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 43
I was.
But you’re not old enough.
Oh, I’m older than I look, young man. I had a very different face then.
Sorry, you’ve lost me.
What’s the Succession of Blood?

Our Empire’s greatest tragedy. Thirty years ago we were at war with ourselves, two families vying for the throne. Aliona of House Gadarel and Prince Kylo of House Sorsha were to be married, in the hope their union would bring peace. But on the eve of the wedding they were assassinated and House Sorsha was massacred by traitors.
(AWKWARD) Yes. Well, that’s not exactly how it happened.
What do you mean?
Well -
COMPUTER BEEP
Doctor. We’ve got the attack squadron’s trajectory... they’re heading for the space station.
Then if we’re to rescue the Empress, that’s where we’ll find her.
(WRATH ENTER -—- MARCHING IN PERFECT UNISON. BORITZ, TEESHA AND
REACT)
By order of Lord Deliverer Tenebris, you are prisoners of the Wrath. You will not resist.
Now, don’t panic. Just do as our militaristic friends say.
THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 44
(CURIOUS) Regimented, featureless, identical. Could be a clone race. But you’re not, are you? You’re something different. Inside that gestalt mind of yours, there’s an inferno of rage boiling away.
You will be silent! Disobey and you will die. Drashani sympathizers and insurgents will die.
Oh. Well. We’re certainly nothing of that kind.
One of you is a Drashani. He will be dealt with.
(NERVOUS) Doctor... I think he means me...
Wrath - listen. This man’s no threat to you. You don’t have to hurt him.
Remain calm and divert your gaze while we execute the Drashani. Direct viewing may cause some retinal damage.
Doctor! Don’t let them kill him!
THE WRATH GESTALT BUZZES LOUDER.
Help me Doctor!
Stop this now!
WRATH GESTALT REACHES A CRESCENDO — SHATTERED BY —-
BESERKER ROAR
(A COUPLE OF FLAMEBOLTS. A SHORT, BRUTAL CLASH. BODIES HIT THE FLAGSTONES, THE WRATH GESTALT IS SILENCED. )
I told you, Doctor. These outworlders are not so fearsome.
RESHEATHES SWORD
Athrid, thank you, your timing was immaculate. I thought you’d gone?
THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 45
Why would I? With cheap ale in the courtyard and messengers waiting for coin. One of them can call my clan here, I needn’t travel.
I suppose not. Dukhin? Are you alright?
Er... I think so.
Good. Athrid — we’re leaving Cawdor Castle. We’d certainly appreciate your sword at our side. Will you join us?
I’1l join you, if we can leave.
What do you mean?
The mother of my brood should have arrived outside but it seems the gates are barred. There are too many of these creatures to get past - even for a warrior of the Tar’khut.
We’re trapped?
No. No, there might be another way.
Really?
These catacombs, Doctor. They’re under every inch of the Castle. Some of the tunnels must lead outside.
A fair point. Well, don’t just stand there then. Lead on. Chop chop, there’s a good chap!
THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 46
23. INT. STORAGE CELL (SPACE-STATION
CRAMPED, METALLIC CELL. VINCOL WAKES WITH A START
Ah!
Vincol! You’re awake.
I... oh my... where am I?
Some kind of cell. They brought us here after they broke in. For a moment there I thought you were dead.
For a moment there, so did I. Well, we’re not, that’s a start. When their leader arrives, I'll talk with him. Negotiate terms for your release.
I don’t think it’ll be that simple. When we first heard about the Wrath, I imagined they were primitive savages. But they’re not. They have a purpose.
A purpose?
I was wrong, Vincol. We were all wrong. These Wrath will tear out the heart of our Empire. And we don’t even know why.
THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 47
24. EXT. BLASTED HEATH (CAWDOR) — DAY
HORSES TROTTING.

I don’t believe it. The Clans of the Steppe call a council of war, something that hasn’t happened for two hundred years and you tell me you’re about to prance off on some suicide mission. You’re a total idiot Athrid.
I leave the Tar’khut in your charge, mother of my brood. Lead them to the gathering — await word of my victory. The Doctor and I have a destiny among the stars!
A destiny among the - ? You are so predictable. He’s wrapping you round his little finger, you know that?
Oh, not at all, dear lady, not at all. I simply explained to Athrid that the leader of the Wrath, this Tenebris fellow, has no interest in Cawdor. He only cares about his Drashani prisoners.

So where else would he go, but the space-station where they are held? Should a man wish to be celebrated as the hero who saved Cawdor, he must go there too. A chance to face the invaders’ warlord in single combat! How could I refuse?
You’ve a one-track flamin’ mind.
For the Tar’khut, blood and glory are prized above all!
I know. That’s why we spend our nights freezing in flamin’ tents.
You go too far, mother of my brood!
Perhaps you two could continue this fascinating debate another time? I think I see my TARDIS parked up ahead.
(UNIMPRESSED) That’s your ship?
THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 48

I’1l recruit a few likely lads to join us, Doctor. We will face down the Wraths’ legions — or die in the attempt! (SHOUTS) There will be blood! There will be glory! There will be songs sung of this day!
I sincerely hope they won’t be dirges.
Ha! I like you, Doctor — you have a mordant wit. (SLAPS HIM ON THE BACK)
Ooof!
ATHRID RIDES OFF.
(SINCERE) Bring him back safely, Doctor. For me.
I’1l do my best, Olerik. I promise.
SHE RIDES OFF AS DUKHIN RIDES UP
Doctor!
Oh, Dukhin, hello.
Doctor, in Mission Control... you said the Succession didn’t happen the way I thought. We were told when Aliona’s wedding galley crashed on Sharnax she and Kylo were killed in the escape attempt.
Well, that much is true, certainly.
Two lovers lost to the Igris.
Those poor creatures, no, not quite.
So what happened?
THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 49
(BEAT) Aliona murdered Kylo, Dukhin. Chopped off his hand and threw him out of an airlock to plummet to his death. One of the most abhorrent acts of evil I’ve ever had the misfortune to witness.
No.
She also ordered the assassination of the entire Royal Family of Sorsha.
But... but we sing songs of her. Tell stories. The great doomed romance.
There were no witnesses, no survivors, bar me, in such circumstances myths have a habit of developing. (BEAT) I’m sorry, Dukhin. I imagine it’s quite a shock.
To put it mildly.
Well, I fear you’1ll have to deal with it later. Round up Boritz and Teesha - we leave in ten minutes.
THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 50
25. INT. CORRIDOR (SPACE-STATION

OLERIK: But they die when you run a sword through their hearts, just like anyone else. I’m not here to debate, Doctor - I’ve got to tell you something. We found some of the mission control crew here in hiding, they showed us this equipment. But they noticed something else. There were explosives missing from the armoury in the catacombs.
DOCTOR: What?
OLERIK: You could only get in with an entry code, and they were all personalised. Doctor. We know who took it.
DOCTOR: Who?
DOCTOR WHO: THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 69
BOMB: Tactical explosive unit primed. Enter override code to disable safety features.
BOMB: Override code verified. Mission-Controller Boritz. Safety features disabled. Insert detonator to activate final sequence.
DOCTOR: Boritz! For pity’s sake, man — what on earth are you doing!
BORITZ: The Drashani brought the apocalypse down on Cawdor, Doctor! Only fair I send them to hell too! Why else d’you think I came? Don’t imagine you can talk me out of it.
DOCTOR: I didn’t. Not for a moment.
DOCTOR: You know, that’s quite unusual for me. I think there’s just something about your face that makes people want to hit it. I’ll take that detonator, thank you. (HE TAKES IT) On your feet, back into the ventilation system with you.
BORITZ: You’re not leaving me here?
DOCTOR: I need another pair of hands. I can’t open the grilles on my own. Life was much easier when I still had a sonic screwdriver. Actually, I’d settle for a regular screwdriver.
BORITZ: The Drashani were going to strip-mine Cawdor. They abandoned us to the Wrath. You really think I’m going to help save their Empress?
DOCTOR WHO: THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 70
DOCTOR: No. But I think you might be willing to save yourself. My priority is getting the Empress off this station. You can come with me and have the faintest chance of survival. Or I can leave you here to face the wrath of the... er, Wrath. Up to you. I take it you’d prefer the former option.
BORITZ: I... I... Yes. Yes, I suppose I do.
DOCTOR: Good. Then let’s be on our way. Give me a boost up, there’s a good fellow.
DOCTOR WHO: THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 71
WRATH: Kneel before Lord Deliverer Tenebris. Disobey and you will die. (BEAT) Slowly.
DUKHIN: OK, don’t push!
TENEBRIS: You are the leaders of the Drashani delegation?
VINCOL: Of those you left alive, yes.
DUKHIN: And you’re Tenebris? The warlord Tenebris?
TENEBRIS: That is the name I use.
DUKHIN: Why do you hate us, Tenebris? What did we do to you?
TENEBRIS: Do?
DUKHIN: A hundred worlds, reduced to rubble! It must have some meaning, some purpose. What do you want?
TENEBRIS: I want nothing from your Empire. Nothing tangible. Only... justice.
DOCTOR WHO: THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 72
CHENTI: You had no right to stop me. I’m the Empress!
TEESHA: Not my Empress. To me, you’re an over-privileged berk with a death-wish.
CHENT: How dare you - !
CHENT: (METALLIC SCRATCHING. A GRILLE CLANGS TO THE DECK. THE TWO
WOMEN: STOP FIGHTING. )
DOCTOR: Hello. Your numbers look a little depleted.
DOCTOR: TEESHA/CHENI: Doctor!
DOCTOR: Let’s postpone the salutations, shall we? Give me your hands, I’1l haul you up here into the ventilation system. Then we can all get off this station.
DOCTOR WHO: THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 73
VINCOL: I’m a diplomat, Tenebris. Whatever happened to you, I guarantee the Empire can offer you appropriate compensation.
TENEBRIS: The Empire made me what I am! Do you think I’d surrender that?
VINCOL: You said you wanted justice, I thought —
TENEBRIS: Yes, justice! For those you tore asunder.
VINCOL: I don’t understand...
DUKHIN: (QUIET) The Igris.
WRATH: All Igris have now been located, Lord Deliverer. Those still at
WRATH: liberty will be brought here.
TENEBRIS: Watch the Igris, Drashani. Now you’1l understand.
TENEBRIS: (A LOW TONE, RISING IN PITCH. A PSYCHIC FORCE — SIMILAR BUT NOT IDENTICAL TO THE ACHERON PULSE. THE IGRIS BECOME AGITATED. )
DOCTOR WHO: THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 74
DOCTOR WHO: (THE DOCTOR LEADS TEESHA, CHENI AND BORITZ ALONG THE PIPE. ALL
CRAWLING: NOISILY. )
BORITZ: Come on...
CHENTI: We've got to find the other survivors from my starcruiser. We have to release them before we leave the space-station.
DOCTOR: When you’re safe, I promise I’1l come back for them.
CHENT: No, we free them now!
DOCTOR: What?
TEESHA: She’s been like this since Vincol told us about the Igris.
DOCTOR: What about them?
TEESHA: She thought they were natural. Some unevolved, primitive life- form. But they’re not.
CHENT: Don’t tell him!
TEESHA: When their Empire expanded, the Drashani took prisoners on every new world. Soldiers, rebels, dissidents — anyone who resisted. Their scientists experimented on them.
CHENTI: No...
DOCTOR: I thought the Igris were a genetically altered species. Are you saying the Drashani created them from their own captives?
TEESHA: The scientists learned how to regress them to a primordial state, fit for mindless labour. Distilled away their higher brain functions.
DOCTOR WHO: THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 75
DOCTOR: That’s horrible.
TEESHA: Isn’t it.
CHENTI: I’m so sorry...
BORITZ: Look! Through the grille! Something’s happening.
BORITZ: (MUFFLED IGRIS GROWLS, AND THE WRATH GESTALT. THEY STOP CRAWLING)
DOCTOR: He’s right. The Wrath are rounding up the Igris. They’re taking them to the main Control Room.
CHENTI: Why?
DOCTOR: I don’t know. But we should find out, I think. We’ve spent more than enough time in these ventilation pipes, it’1l be good to stretch our legs.
BORITZ: What? But what about your “getting off the station” idea? I liked that...
DOCTOR: Patience, Mission-Controller. Help me with this grille.
DOCTOR WHO: THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 76
DOCTOR WHO: (THE PSYCHIC FORCE IS AT VERY HIGH FREQUENCY. IGRIS SHRIEK IN PAIN! )
DUKHIN: Tenebris! Stop! The Igris are in agony!
TENEBRIS: Silence, Drashani! This is the legacy of your imperialism!
DOCTOR WHO: THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 77
DOCTOR WHO: (THE DOCTOR'S PARTY WATCH, UNSEEN. UNLESS NOTED, THEY’RE WHISPERING. IGRIS SHRIEKS CONTINUE, AT A DISTANCE. )
TEESHA: Was that Dukhin? Is he alright? I can’t see anything from here.
BORITZ: Shush! Don’t let them hear you!
DOCTOR: Dukhin and Vincol appear unharmed. But I can’t say the same for the Igris.
CHENT: That must be Tenebris.
DOCTOR: He certainly he fits the description.
CHENT: He’s tearing the Igris apart with some psychic force. Those poor creatures!
DOCTOR: Perhaps.
BORITZ: What’s that? There’s some kind of energy around them, in the air.
TEESHA: I see it. It’s making them shimmer.
DOCTOR: .AS though something’s forming.
CHENI: (NOT WHISPERING) It’s monstrous! I can’t watch this! I’ve got to stop it!
DOCTOR: Cheni, no!
BORITZ: Doctor! She’ll get us all killed! We’ve got to get away before the Wrath spot us!
DOCTOR WHO: THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 78
TEESHA: Too late!
DOCTOR: (URGENT) Teesha — take this. Keep it safe.
TEESHA: What is it? A detonator?
DOCTOR: For Boritz’s bomb. I can’t risk Tenebris getting hold of it, who knows what he might do.
TEESHA: Boritz’s bomb?
BORITZ: I was going blow up the Avionics Nexus - cut the power to the life-support. (DEFENSIVE) What? I didn’t do it.
DOCTOR: I'd recommend you both give yourselves up. It’s only the
DOCTOR: Drashani they hate, remember.
TEESHA: Why, what are you going to do?
DOCTOR: Cheni’s forced my hand rather. I’m going to try to reason with our masked adversary.
WRATH: Surrender! Or you will be incinerated!
TEESHA: They’ve seen us!
BORITZ: Surrender to them? No chance, there’s time, we can still get away, run!
TEESHA: Boritz, don’t be a fool!
DOCTOR WHO: THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003)
TEESHA: Oh, Boritz...
WRATH: Surrender. Or you will be incinerated.
TEESHA: I don’t have much choice, do I?
TEESHA: Page 79
DOCTOR WHO: THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 80
DOCTOR WHO: (THE PSYCHIC WHINE RISES, IGRIS MOAN IN PAIN. CHENI MARCHES IN. )
CHENI: Tenebris! Tenebris! Stop this at once!
TENEBRIS: You? How can it be you?
DUKHIN: No, your highness, get back, you -
WRATH: Halt. Or we will destroy you.
DUKHIN: I’ve halted, I’ve halted!
CHENT: I order you to stop this obscenity!
TENEBRIS: Aliona? Still so young...?
CHENT: What? No. Aliona was my cousin. I’m Cheni — daughter of Tuvold.
TENEBRIS: Your cousin? You’re the Empress?
CHENT: And you’re a backwater warlord. I demand you release the Igris. I won’t see them tortured!
DOCTOR: Cheni, please, Tenebris is more dangerous than you know. It would best if you let me deal with him.
TENEBRIS: What are you, her jester? Going by your attire I assume that’s your role in the proceedings.
DOCTOR: The Wrath call you Lord Deliverer. What did you save them from, I wonder?
TENEBRIS: You could not begin to imagine.
DOCTOR WHO: THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 81
DOCTOR: Oh, I’m rather afraid I can. I’ve been watching your right hand, Tenebris. There’s a delay, a microsecond or two, most people wouldn’t even notice. It’s a cybernetic appliance, isn’t it? You know, I met a young Drashani once, quite a temperamental chap - his hand was severed in the skies above Sharnax, I wonder if perhaps you could be related...
TENEBRIS: (QUIET) Who are you? How could you know this?
DOCTOR: I’m the Doctor.
TENEBRIS: The Doctor? But your face... it’s... it’s changed.
DOCTOR: (SIGHS) And so has yours. I’d hoped I was wrong.
CHENTI: The Doctor has no authority here, warlord. I do. I ordered you to release the Igris.
TENEBRIS: Very well.
CHENT: You're killing them! Stop now! Or I’1l stop you myself!
DOCTOR: Vincol, Dukhin, keep her back! Don’t let her interfere!
VINCOL: Ma’am, please!
VINCOL: (HE DRAGS CHENI OFF TO A SAFE DISTANCE. THE SOUNDS OF THE IGRIS
ARE: FADING. )
CHENT: Doctor, they’re dying! The Igris are dying!
DOCTOR: I don’t think so. The energy around them’s taking shape! Becoming alive! Can’t you see what’s happening?
DOCTOR WHO: THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 82
DUKHIN: Emperor’s blood! More Wrath!
CHENT: Forming out of thin air!
DOCTOR: He’s releasing the Igris — precisely as you demanded. Freeing them from their suffering.
CHENTI: What?
DOCTOR: Isn’t that right? Prince Kylo?
CHENTI: Kylo? You’re -
TENEBRIS: Yes. So you do understand, jester. I am glad. Thanks to you, the Empire will know at last the nemesis that scourges their worlds. I am Kylo, last heir of Sorsha. And the Igris are my WRATH!
CLOSING: THEME
CLOSING: END OF PART TWO
DOCTOR WHO: THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 83

elements.text: PART THREE
44. INT/EXT. SHUTTLE (CONTROL) — ‘THE BURNING PRINCE’ REPRISE
(SMASH CUT INTO SCENE 111 - ).
Hold me, Kylo. Please. Hold me. Take me in your arms. I love you.
PAUSE
My love.
(KYLO WALKS ACROSS THE ROOM. HOLDS HER. KISSES HER. BREAKS APART)
Oh, my love, my love, what have you done? What have we both done? This war has destroyed us. We are one. We should be one.
I know.
I love you.
Love. (BEAT) Ah. Bless.
(WITH A CRY SHE SHOVES HIM INTO THE AIRLOCK. HITS A DOOR CONTROL, THE INNER DOOR SEALS)
(MUFFLED, BANGING AGAINST DOOR) Aliona! Aliona, what are you doing? Let me out of the airlock!
Say hello to your family, my Prince.
SHE HITS ANOTHER BUTTON. KYLO IS SUCKED OUT OF THE AIRLOCK
(PLUMMETTING AWAY) Noooooooo-!
CUT TO OPENING THEME
THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 84
45. EXT. SHARNAX (SWAMP) — ‘THE BURNING PRINCE’ REPRISE
(FROM SCENE 114 -
POOLS BUBBLE. UNKNOWN CREATURES SCUTTLE AND BELCH. )
MOANS) But... I'm alive... I'm... how am I alive... (MOVES
Argh! Aliona.. I’m hurt... I.. I think my leg might be broken...
A GROWL, SOME WAY OFF.
Igris! Please... No, I —
(THE SNARLING GETS CLOSER. THE IGRIS APPROACHING EN MASSE. A
SPLINTER THROUGH DRY BRANCHES. )
Stay back!
THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 85
46. INT. CONTROL ROOM (SPACE-STATION
BEGIN WITH A REPRISE OF THE LAST LINE FROM PART TWO:
So you do understand, jester. I am glad. Thanks to you, the Empire will know at last the nemesis that scourges their worlds. I am Kylo, last heir of Sorsha. And the Igris are my WRATH!
I suspected as much. But your appearance here’s something of a surprise. I thought you’d fallen to your death thirty years ago on Sharnax.
And I did. Kylo died that day. Why do you think I chose a new name? That sad, unworldly prince is long gone. Now only Tenebris remains.
He wasn’t sad, he was young. Naive. Used.
He was a fool!
There’s nothing foolish about love. And you really did love Aliona, didn’t you?
(BEAT) It is you, isn’t it? The Doctor. But you look so different.
Oh my species have a somewhat relaxed attitude towards personal physiognomy. I change my face with remarkable alacrity. (BEAT) How did you survive the fall? Telekinesis?

The secret shame of my family. My dead family. For years, they hid me away, until the war took both my brothers. Then they dispatched me to the altar with my dowry, like a girl. They medicated the fires in my mind. And after years of disgrace... it’s my mind that saves me at the end.
I saw your power. It was beyond your control.
Aliona dropped me out of an airlock, thirty three thousand feet up. You’d be surprised how quickly that can focus the mind.
THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 86
47. EXT. UPPER ATMOSPHERE (SHARNAX) — FLASHBACK
(AIR WHIPS AND ROARS! ALMOST BURIED IN THE TORNADE-FORCE GALES, KYLO’S SCREAM FROM SCENE 111 OF ‘BURNING PRINCE’. )

The ability to psychically manoeuvre objects without touching them. That’s how you described it, Doctor. If only you’d experienced it. I didn’t consciously understand what I’d done at first, it happened almost without thinking. But when I looked back, I knew. As I fell, the swamp had reached up to me. Not just plants and animals - the earth, the water, the atmosphere itself. Every molecule, all connected, and I was a part of it. I was a mote in the air, I was the air that carried the mote. And every vein in my body burned so brightly!
KYLO’S SCREAM RECEDES.
THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 87
48. INT. CONTROL ROOM (SPACE-STATION
(CHENI, DUKHIN AND VINCOL WATCH FROM THE FAR SIDE OF THE
ROOM.
What’s he saying? He’s Kylo?
I’1l explain later.
Quiet, both of you. Listen.
WRATH APPROACH, DRAGGING TEESHA
You will wait with these others until Lord Deliverer Tenebris
makes his judgement.
All right, all right!
Teesha! I hoped you’d escaped.
THE WRATH MARCHES OFF
You again?
We must stop meeting like this. What have I missed?
THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 88
49. EXT. SHARNAX (SWAMP) — ‘THE BURNING PRINCE’ REPRISE
(FROM SCENE 114 - THE IGRIS APPROACHING EN MASSE. )
eo lek Stay back all of you or I’1ll burn this whole swamp, I’il - !
THE IGRIS GROWL, UNCERTAIN.
What? You understand me? Yes... yes, you can understand me...
MORE SNARLS AND GROWLS. BUT THE IGRIS SEEM ALMOST DOCILE...
I was right. In Empire’s name. I WAS RIGHT!
WITH A CRY AND A MANIACAL LAUGH, HE BURSTS INTO FLAME.
Come my friends! Watch! WATCH! ME! BURN!
HE BLAZES.
THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 89
50. INT. CONTROL ROOM (SPACE-STATION
BACK TO THE DOCTOR & TENEBRIS.
The Igris saw my mind’s fury unleashed. Power beyond their primal comprehension. They bowed down. Made me their leader... their God. What else could they do?
I’ve seen a lot of suffering, Tenebris. I’ve tried to help, where I can. But there are times when suffering makes its victim a monster.
You think I’m a monster?
You're hardly going out of your way to refute it.
The Wrath would disagree with you. I saved their souls from exile, as you’ve seen. I gave them purpose, direction. They were blank slates, to be programmed any way I desired.
And you programmed them to hate the Drashani.
After all the Empire had done to them, Doctor, I found they needed very little persuasion.
THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 90
51. INT. CATACOMBS VAULT (CAWDOR CASTLE
ARMOUR CLANKS. AN ARMY PREPARING FOR WAR.
These catacombs reach every corner of the castle, clan- brothers. Surprise is on our side, we can strike before dawn. You! Any word from the archers?
Yes. They sent a stormpigeon.
A stormpigeon? We’re facing a world-devouring horde of demons from beyond the stars, and our archers sent a stormpigeon?
Er, yes.
(SIGHS) I suppose they’re doing their best. What did they say?
When the third moon kisses the Peak of Carthiz, they’1ll be in position.
Then we’re on. Pass the word round. The wolves of Tar’khut win back Cawdor tonight!
THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 91
52. INT. CONTROL ROOM (SPACE-STATION
I fashioned the Wrath into my army and launched my fleet.

Yes, I was wondering about that. Your telekinesis kept you alive, Tenebris. It gave you power over the Igris. But even a mind such as yours can’t survive the extremes of space. How did you escape Sharnax?
You forget. Sharnax was a former mining colony.
Of course. A scrapyard of dilapidated derelicts.
It took me twenty-five years to construct my fleet. But construct: 1t).1 did.
And did you also fashion the Acheron Pulse from the flotsam you found on Sharnax?
You give me too much credit. I’m not that clever. The Acheron Pulse was my Wraths’ gift to me, in gratitude for their salvation.
Then your weapon comes from the Wrath themselves?
From their suffering — powered and directed by my rudimentary technology.
I don’t understand.
The scientists of House Sorsha created the Igris by tearing out their prisoners’ souls, Doctor. Did you not think to wonder where those souls went?
THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 92
53. INT. CONTROL ROOM (SPACE-STATION
We should help him.
Stay here, ma’am. We’re safe as long as the Doctor’s got his attention.
DUKHIN MOANS
Dukhin — your arm? Are you hurt?
It’s nothing.
No, let me look...
SHE EXAMINES IT
It’s been burnt!
When did this happen?
When I tried to stop the Empress approaching Tenebris. One of the Wrath flamebolts must have... winged me...
It was that close?
He’s slightly singed, that’s all.
You could have been incinerated!
It’s my fault. He was trying to protect me.
Of course he was.
But I don’t deserve that - my family’s actions shame the name of Gadarel. Of the Empire!
THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 93
Dukhin would lay down his life for you, Ma’am. As would I.
Then your Empress can do no less.
Highness?
The Doctor told me to keep you away from Tenebris, Ma’am.
And are you the Doctor’s subject, Vincol? Or mine?
THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 94
54. EXT. SHARNAX (SWAMP) — FLASHBACK
(FX FROM SCENE 114 OF ‘THE BURNING PRINCE’ —
POOLS BUBBLE. UNKNOWN CREATURES SCUTTLE AND BELCH. )

I was marooned on Sharnax for two and a half decades. I had always felt a link to the Igris. Mentally. I reached out to them, and the barrier between their minds and mine crumbled. I found I could soothe their pain - their rage. And one day... I broke through.
THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 95
55. EXT. THE UNDERVOID — FLASHBACK
(A SOUND LIKE TEARING PAPER. THEN... BIRDS’ WINGS FLAP. ROARING,
AIR. CHATTERING VOICES — LIKE THE WRATH GESTALT MIND... BUT THESE VOICES ARE DISCORDANT. FRIGHTENED. HURT. OCCASIONAL WAILS AND SCREAMS. )
I didn’t mean to go there. But the membrane separating the Igris from that other place was so very fragile. Like cobwebs...
Kylo. / Please, Kylo. / Help me. / Find us. / Free us.
THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 96
56. INT. CONTROL ROOM (SPACE-STATION
You tore a hole through to them. What did you find on the other Side? A pocket dimension?
Nothing so commonplace. I found a wasteland of the mind. Perhaps it was created spontaneously, by the Drashani experiments. Or perhaps it always existed, waiting for spirits to populate it.
You brought them back.
One by one, I freed their disembodied souls. I fashioned them into the Wrath.
And in doing so, created the Acheron Pulse. An obscene weapon that has no place in our universe.
Would you have done differently, Doctor? Or would you have left them to drift forever, formless and alone?
Maybe that would have been best.
You can’t imagine that place, Doctor. I called it the Undervoid. But were I a religious man, I’d know it by its true name.
CHENI’S HEELS ECHO AS SHE APPROACHES.
Purgatory.
Empress! I told you to stay with the others!
I’m not in the habit of taking orders, Doctor.
Aliona...
Cheni.
THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 97
Cheni, yes, Cheni.
(URGENT) Imperial Highness - your subjects attest to your sagacity. But believe me, your wisest course is to not say another word. Truly, it’s for all our sakes!
The Empress wishes to speak. And I wish to hear her. We’ve quite a history, her family and I.
(FORMAL) Prince Kylo - as ruler of the Drashani Empire, I kneel before you in penitent humility.
Oh no...

You surrendered your life in defence of fair Aliona, and Tenebris the warlord was born of your sacrifice. My Empire’s scientists created the Igris, and the Wrath rose from their pain. The Doctor called you a monster, but there are no monsters here. We are all victims.
In defence of fair Aliona? Is that what you said?
Empress!

The last heir of Sorsha gave all to protect his pure bride from those who opposed their union. And yet you live! When the Empire hears this glorious news, there will be rejoicing like nothing [in memory] —
? (BOILING RAGE) His pure bride? His pure... bride?
Yes, his — what’s the matter?
AN EXPLOSION OF FIRE FROM THE WALL.
GASPS
THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 98
57. EXT. COURTYARD (CAWDOR CASTLE
(NIGHT SOUNDS. AND A CADRE OF NOMADS, CLAMBERING OUT OF THE CATACOMBS... AS STEALTHY AS THEIR CLANKING ARMOUR ALLOWS. )
(WHISPERS) Is everyone out of the catacombs? Good. Close the doors — pay attention!
THE NOMADS SETTLE.

When the third moon skims Carthiz Peak, our archers are going to open fire from the hillside. While the Wrath are busy with them, we’ll take the East Gate. That’1l open the way for the horsemen. Any questions? (SILENCE) Good. Then for the next two minutes, I want you praying to your ancestors. It’s time those Spiritual layabouts started earning their offerings!
Yes leader!
The hillside, look! The arrows are flying!
Well, that’s it then. Forget the prayers, clan-brothers! Trust in the man beside you and your own right arm! (YELLS) BLOOD AND GLORY!
BLOOD AND GLORY!
LED BY OLERIK, THE NOMADS CHARGE — ROARING!
THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 99
58. INT. CONTROL ROOM (SPACE-STATION
AN ELECTRICAL FIRE’S STILL BURNING.
Tenebris! Kylo! Listen to me! Cheni doesn’t know what you’ve suffered! I do. Don’t listen to her - listen to me!
My pure bride? That murderess!
ANOTHER EXPLOSION!
Doctor! What’s wrong with him?
Excuse my lack of tact, your Highness — but please, stop talking! Tenebris! You’ve burned a path halfway to the Gadarel Homeworld. What happens when you get there?
I will have vengeance, Doctor!
ANOTHER EXPLOSION!
You won’t find what you’re looking for, Kylo. Aliona died thirty years ago. She escaped you!

Do you think I don’t know that? I found out when I left Sharnax. After all those years, all those years of pain, to discover the one who caused them is gone. Long gone! Can you imagine how that feels?
What are you going to do? Destroy an Empire, simply because you fell for the wrong princess?
YES!
ANOTHER EXPLOSION
No, Doctor, I have heard enough.
Cheni, please!
THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 100
I said no!
BEAT. TENEBRIS CALMS
What?
Tenebris is a mask, Doctor. The man behind it is not Tenebris. He’s Kylo, a Drashani of noble birth. People don’t change, whatever terrible things they might have experienced.
Oh, they do. They really do. Take my word for it.
The Empress wishes to say something, Doctor, I would advise you to let her.

I am most grateful, noble Prince. Earlier, I offered my Empire’s contrition to you. That was not enough. I’ve known the tale of Kylo and Aliona since I was a babe in arms. I should have understood these stories don’t end with recompense. They end with... love.
Love.
Love?
Yes — love.
Love. Ah. Bless.
