TENEBRIS: Would you have done differently, Doctor? Or would you have left them to drift forever, formless and alone?
DOCTOR: Maybe that would have been best.
TENEBRIS: You can’t imagine that place, Doctor. I called it the Undervoid. But were I a religious man, I’d know it by its true name.
CHENTI: Purgatory.
DOCTOR: Empress! I told you to stay with the others!
CHENT: I’m not in the habit of taking orders, Doctor.
TENEBRIS: Aliona...
CHENT: Cheni.
DOCTOR WHO: THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 97
TENEBRIS: Cheni, yes, Cheni.
DOCTOR: (URGENT) Imperial Highness - your subjects attest to your sagacity. But believe me, your wisest course is to not say another word. Truly, it’s for all our sakes!
TENEBRIS: The Empress wishes to speak. And I wish to hear her. We’ve quite a history, her family and I.
CHENT: (FORMAL) Prince Kylo - as ruler of the Drashani Empire, I kneel before you in penitent humility.
DOCTOR: Oh no...
CHENT: You surrendered your life in defence of fair Aliona, and Tenebris the warlord was born of your sacrifice. My Empire’s scientists created the Igris, and the Wrath rose from their pain. The Doctor called you a monster, but there are no monsters here. We are all victims.
TENEBRIS: In defence of fair Aliona? Is that what you said?
DOCTOR: Empress!
CHENT: The last heir of Sorsha gave all to protect his pure bride from those who opposed their union. And yet you live! When the Empire hears this glorious news, there will be rejoicing like nothing [in memory] —
TENEBRIS: ? (BOILING RAGE) His pure bride? His pure... bride?
CHENT: Yes, his — what’s the matter?
DOCTOR WHO: THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 98
DOCTOR WHO: (NIGHT SOUNDS. AND A CADRE OF NOMADS, CLAMBERING OUT OF THE CATACOMBS... AS STEALTHY AS THEIR CLANKING ARMOUR ALLOWS. )
OLERIK: (WHISPERS) Is everyone out of the catacombs? Good. Close the doors — pay attention!
OLERIK: When the third moon skims Carthiz Peak, our archers are going to open fire from the hillside. While the Wrath are busy with them, we’ll take the East Gate. That’1l open the way for the horsemen. Any questions? (SILENCE) Good. Then for the next two minutes, I want you praying to your ancestors. It’s time those Spiritual layabouts started earning their offerings!
NOMADS: Yes leader!
NOMAD: The hillside, look! The arrows are flying!
OLERIK: Well, that’s it then. Forget the prayers, clan-brothers! Trust in the man beside you and your own right arm! (YELLS) BLOOD AND GLORY!
NOMADS: BLOOD AND GLORY!
DOCTOR WHO: THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 99
DOCTOR: Tenebris! Kylo! Listen to me! Cheni doesn’t know what you’ve suffered! I do. Don’t listen to her - listen to me!
TENEBRIS: My pure bride? That murderess!
CHENT: Doctor! What’s wrong with him?
DOCTOR: Excuse my lack of tact, your Highness — but please, stop talking! Tenebris! You’ve burned a path halfway to the Gadarel Homeworld. What happens when you get there?
TENEBRIS: I will have vengeance, Doctor!
DOCTOR: You won’t find what you’re looking for, Kylo. Aliona died thirty years ago. She escaped you!
TENEBRIS: Do you think I don’t know that? I found out when I left Sharnax. After all those years, all those years of pain, to discover the one who caused them is gone. Long gone! Can you imagine how that feels?
DOCTOR: What are you going to do? Destroy an Empire, simply because you fell for the wrong princess?
TENEBRIS: YES!
CHENTI: No, Doctor, I have heard enough.
DOCTOR: Cheni, please!
DOCTOR WHO: THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 100
CHENT: I said no!
TENEBRIS: What?
CHENT: Tenebris is a mask, Doctor. The man behind it is not Tenebris. He’s Kylo, a Drashani of noble birth. People don’t change, whatever terrible things they might have experienced.
DOCTOR: Oh, they do. They really do. Take my word for it.
TENEBRIS: The Empress wishes to say something, Doctor, I would advise you to let her.
CHENT: I am most grateful, noble Prince. Earlier, I offered my Empire’s contrition to you. That was not enough. I’ve known the tale of Kylo and Aliona since I was a babe in arms. I should have understood these stories don’t end with recompense. They end with... love.
TENEBRIS: Love.
DOCTOR: Love?
CHENT: Yes — love.
TENEBRIS: Love. Ah. Bless.
CHENT: Together, sweet Kylo, we’ll undo the errors of my father’s generation. The Great Houses of Gadarel and Sorsha will be united, as they were always meant to be. I offer you my hand in marriage — and a place beside me on the Drashani throne.
DOCTOR: No.
TENEBRIS: (BEAT) You think a royal wedding will end this war?
DOCTOR WHO: THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 101
CHENT: All fairytales end with marriage.
TENEBRIS: (ALMOST BUYING IT) You would wed me?
CHENI: I would. My cousin was lost to you, but I shall take her place. In time, you might come to love me as you did her.
TENBERIS: T=
CHENI: Please.
TENEBRIS: (BEAT) You may remove my mask. I would have my bride look upon my naked face.
DOCTOR: Cheni.. I’m begging you. Don’t do this.
CHENT: Doctor, you are wise in many matters. But I don’t think you understand love at all.
CHENT: How long have you worn this mask? It doesn’t matter. Soon it will be gone. And I’1l see the face of Kylo. The noble Prince Kylo, the man I’ve loved since I was a child and —
TENEBRIS: (HOARSE, CROAKING) It turns out the atmosphere of Sharnax is mildly acidic, Empress. None of our miners there lived long enough to notice any effects, but let me assure you that prolonged exposure is not recommended. Twenty five years grovelling in its swamps left their mark. Still, it’s what’s inside that counts.
CHENT: Your face, it -
DOCTOR: Cheni!
TENEBRIS: My Wrath, hold him.
DOCTOR WHO: THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 102
DOCTOR: What? No!
TENEBRIS: Of course you tremble. It’s revolting. I knew you would not be able to stomach it. You talk to me of love? I have heard such lies from your family before!
CHENT: Doctor! Doctor, help me!
TENEBRIS: He can’t! No one can. Wrath — the Acheron Pulse!
DOCTOR WHO: THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 103
DOCTOR WHO: (THE PULSE CHAMBER'S GLASS HUMS AND SINGS. ENERGY FIZZES. THE
WRATH: GESTALT MURMURS AS THEY MANIPULATE CONSOLE CONTROLS. )
WRATH LEADER: Initiate Pulse. Narrow beam. Target: Empress Cheni Gadarel.
WRATH: Pulse initiated.
DOCTOR WHO: THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 104
DOCTOR WHO: (THE HOWL OF THE ACHERON PULSE BEGINS. THE DOCTOR'S STRUGGLING IN THE WRATHS’ GRIP.)
DOCTOR: Tenebris! She didn’t know! None of this is her fault!
DOCTOR: Tenebris! Please!
TENEBRIS: Not all fairytales end with marriage, Empress. Some end very badly indeed.
DOCTOR: Cheni was a baby when your family died, Tenebris! I was there! Blame me! Spare her, take me instead!
CHENT: Doctor! My skin’s stretching! Swelling! What’s happening!
CHENT: Help me! My thoughts, my memories... they’re slipping away...
DOCTOR: Cheni. Oh Cheni...
CHENT: I don’t want to lose them, Doctor. I don’t want to lose what I am. I don’t want to become...
CHENT: (A FINAL, DECISIVE CRACK OF SHIFTING BONE. A PAUSE. THEN... THE
LOW: GROWL OF AN IGRIS. THE ACHERON PULSE STOPS. A BEAT.)
DOCTOR: Oh no.
TENEBRIS: Goodbye, Empress. You see now, Doctor. The Acheron Pulse doesn’t kill its victims.
DOCTOR WHO: THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 105
DOCTOR: No. It distills away their higher brain functions. Hurls their psyches into that place you called the Undervoid. Leaving only - an Igris.
TENEBRIS: You knew?
DOCTOR: I guessed. A dozen astronauts hit by the first Pulse. A dozen too many Igris on this space-station. Maths was never my strongest suit but that wasn’t complicated. Almost as simple as what happens next.
TENEBRIS: What’s that?
DOCTOR: (CERTAINTY) You’re going to bring Cheni back.
TENEBRIS: Ha. Impossible. Once the soul’s severed and the Igris manifested, the two parts cannot be recombined.
DOCTOR: I promised to look after her.
TENEBRIS: You promised you’d stop Aliona killing my family too, you didn’t do that either. Wrath — guard the prisoners. If they try to escape, kill them. Doctor, come with me.
DOCTOR: Where?
TENEBRIS: My flagship. You asked what I’11 do when I reach Gadarel Prime. It’s time you had your answer.
TENEBRIS: (A DOOR SWOOSHES. THEY EXIT. IT CLOSES. THE IGRIS, FORMERLY
EMPRESS: CHENI, GROWLS. )
DOCTOR WHO: THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 106
DOCTOR WHO: (EXPLOSIONS! THE BUZZ OF THE WRATH GESTALT! CLANKING ARMOUR AND THE CLASH OF WEAPONS. )
OLERIK: (SHOUTING) The Wrath are falling back, wolves of Tar’khut! The East Gate’s ours!
OLERIK: Open the doors! Raise the portcullis! Once our horsemen are in the castle, we’ll take the day!
OLERIK: Where did that lot come from?
NOMAD: They’re regrouping! They’re fighting back!
OLERIK: Is that so? (SHOUTING ABOVE THE BATTLE) We’1ll show them!
OLERIK: (SHE DRAWS HER SWORD. HACK! SLASH! SQUELCH! THE SOUNDS CONTINUE
UNDER: HER SPEECH — )
OLERIK: These scalps are for you, father of my brood!
DOCTOR WHO: THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 107
DOCTOR WHO: (GLASS VIBRATES. HIGH ABOVE, POWER SPARKS AND FIZZES. A DOOR
SWOOSHES: OPEN. THE DOCTOR AND TENEBRIS ENTER. )
TENEBRIS: My Wrath call this the Pulse Chamber, Doctor. It’s here that they generate and focus their Acheron Pulse. Perhaps you recognise its central component?
DOCTOR: A Praxis Valve. The primary power-core from the Drashani delegation’s starcruiser.
TENEBRIS: The batteries I took from Sharnax were old. Their fading power limited my Wraths’ effectiveness. They could obliterate a town, a small island — nothing larger. That’s why this space-station was a perfect target.
DOCTOR: But now the Pulse is a million times stronger.
TENEBRIS: A million? You underestimate the Empire’s technological prowess, Doctor. Heated to plasmic temperatures, the gasses in the Praxis Valve produce enough energy to warp space itself.
DOCTOR: Cheni doesn’t deserve her fate, Tenebris. If you can’t reverse her transformation, won’t you at least free her from the Undervoid? Make her a fresh Wrath, for your army.
TENEBRIS: The Empress of the Drashani should take a little time to think about what she’s done. Twenty-five years perhaps. When I conquer Gadarel Prime, maybe I’1l parade her hollow remnant through the streets in chains. I look forward to watching her subjects turn away in disgust when they see what she’s become.
DOCTOR: And then what?
TENEBRIS: You must have guessed that. I’1ll unleash the Acheron Pulse. With this Praxis Valve’s power, I can target an entire planet. In a matter of hours, Gadarel Prime will be another Sharnax. A world of Igris.
DOCTOR: I won’t let that happen.
DOCTOR WHO: THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 108
TENEBRIS: That’s an empty vow, them.
DOCTOR: You’1ll pay for this.
TENEBRIS: I’ve been paying for
DOCTOR: Mine?
DOCTOR: Doctor. You do make rather a habit of
DOCTOR: decades. And it’s your fault.
DOCTOR WHO: THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 109
VINCOL: (CHILDLIKE DENIAL) She’s not gone, is she? Not really. She can’t be. That... thing will disappear, she’1ll be OK, she’11...
DUKHIN: Chief Advocate? Are you alright?
TEESHA: How could he be alright, after what just happened? He’s in shock. We should make him comfortable. Help me move him.
DUKHIN: Come along, Vincol. You need to rest. Everything’s going to fine.
VINCOL: (BROKEN) Empress Cheni’s the wisest, most noble ruler the Empire’s known...
TEESHA: Doesn’t say much for your Empire. She had heart, though, there’s no denying that.
DUKHIN: What’s this? You dropped it. A detonator?
TEESHA: Oh, yeah... Boritz brought a bomb.
DUKHIN: A bomb?
TEESHA: He was going blow up the Avionics Nexus. The Doctor stopped him.
VINCOL: (BEAT) Give it to me.
TEESHA: (PICKING IT UP) Best if I hang onto it, I reckon.
VINCOL: I said give it to me!
DOCTOR WHO: THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 110
TEESHA: And I said no!
TEESHA: (WITH NO WARNING, VINCOL DRAWS HIS MESON-BODKIN. IT FIRES UP WITH A CRACKLE OF ELECTRICAL ENERGY. )
DUKHIN: Teesha! Watch out, he’s still got his meson-bodkin!
VINCOL: I’ve got it!
WRATH: A prisoner is attempting escape! (STARTS TO APPROACH) Halt! Disobey and you will die!
VINCOL: Yes I’ll die! We’1l all die!
DUKHIN: Teesha! DUCK!
DUKHIN: (WRATH FLAMEBOLTS FIRE. THEY MISS. VINCOL PUNCHES THE DOOR
CONTROL: - IT SWOOSHES CLOSED AFTER HIM. )
DUKHIN: He got away! Are you alright? He nearly cut your hand open...
TEESHA: I’1ll be fine. We’ve got to get to the Avionics Nexus. Stop him before he can trigger the bomb. Come on!
TEESHA: (A WRATH FLAMEBOLT EXPLODES, CLOSE, AS THE APPROACHING WRATH ARRIVES. )
WRATH: Prisoners will not attempt to escape.
TEESHA: Oh don’t be stupid, I’m trying to save all of us!
DUKHIN: Teesha - do as they say! They’1ll kill you
DOCTOR WHO: THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 111
DOCTOR: My fault? How is it my fault?
TENEBRIS: You saved my life, Doctor. Don’t you remember? Kept me from death just long enough that Aliona could spring her trap and wipe out my family.
DOCTOR: There was no way I could have predicted what she was going to do!
TENEBRIS: Is that your defence? That you couldn’t have known? My Wraths’ crusade will continue. And you are responsible for every life we take.
DOCTOR: No!
WRATH: Communication from Cawdor. Status update: rebellion.
TENEBRIS: No conqueror can tolerate civil unrest. Wrath - prepare to launch a planet-wide Acheron Pulse!
WRATH: As you command, Lord Deliverer.
DOCTOR: Kylo, please!
TENEBRIS: Tenebris, Doctor.
DOCTOR: You can’t do this!
TENEBRIS: Yes, Doctor. I can.
DOCTOR WHO: THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 112
DOCTOR WHO: (THE BUZZ OF THE WRATH GESTALT. THE GUTTURAL GROWLS OF CHENI’S IGRIS. )
TEESHA: We have to get out of here, Dukhin. We don’t have much time.
DUKHIN: The Wrath will kill us if we try to get past them.
TEESHA: Vincol made it. Maybe we can. We’ve got to try. Wish me luck.
DUKHIN: No!
WRATH: Halt!
DUKHIN: Teesha! Look out! Get behind the consoles!
DUKHIN: (FRANTIC) Here! Look at me — I’m escaping! See?
WRATH: Ignore him. Terminate the woman.
WRATH LEADER: The Igris is attacking! Redirect all fire. Destroy the beast.
WRATH: Tenebris be praised.
TEESHA: Dukhin! What’s happening?
DUKHIN: The Empress! She’s protecting us! She’s giving her life so we can escape!
DOCTOR WHO: THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 113
TEESHA: Well, let’s not disappoint her! Into the corridor! Come on!
TEESHA: (THEY HURRY OUT, THE DOOR SWOOSHES CLOSED AFTER THEM. BEHIND THEM, THE BATTLE BETWEEN THE WRATH AND THE IGRIS CONTINUES. )
DOCTOR WHO: THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 114
DOCTOR: For pity’s sake! Those natives are fighting with nothing more than pointy sticks and sheer guts! They don’t stand a chance, you’ve no reason to destroy their world.
TENEBRIS: Dismantling an Empire is bound to involve casualties, Doctor.
DOCTOR: I won’t allow this! You’ve already taken Empress Cheni. She was dragging her Empire forward! Now she’s gone and all you offer is destruction!
WRATH: Acheron Pulse initiated.
WRATH: (THE GLASS AND MIRRORS IN THE PULSE CHAMBER VIBRATE MORE LOUDLY, INCREASING IN PITCH...)
DOCTOR WHO: THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 115
DOCTOR WHO: (A CAVALRY CHARGE! POUNDING HOOVES AND THE FLAMEBOLTS OF THE WRATH! )
NOMAD: We've secured the Main Keep, clan-mother. By sunrise, Cawdor Castle will be [ours]— (HE SCREAMS)
OLERIK: What’s that?
NOMAD: My skin! It’s stretching! I can’t — (SCREAMS)
OLERIK: Their weapon! (SHOUTS) Fall back, clan-brothers! Retreat to the
OLERIK: catacombs!
DOCTOR WHO: THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 116
DOCTOR WHO: (THE WRATH MANIPULATE CONSOLES, ON THE FAR SIDE OF THE CHAMBER FROM THE DOCTOR AND TENEBRIS. )
DOCTOR: The Drashani Empire’s capable of progress, Tenebris, it could be a beacon of civilisation. And you want to snuff it out!
WRATH: Acheron Pulse engaged. Praxis spectrum gasses approaching optimal temperature. Complete planetary conversion: T minus three hours.
WRATH LEADER: Wait. Listen.
TENEBRIS: Unlike you, Doctor, I don’t claim to serve a greater good. I created the Wrath to enact my vengeance. The consequences are not my concern.
DOCTOR: No. No. No! The planet below us is dying, and YOU gave the order! You can’t simply deny you’re responsible!
WRATH LEADER: This debate is troubling. Tenebris delivered the Wrath. He gave us purpose.
WRATH: Designation of purpose: revenge. But the Doctor claims Tenebris is incorrect.
WRATH LEADER: If true, then the Wrath’s purpose is also incorrect.
WRATH: This uncertainty is unacceptable. The contradiction must be resolved.
DOCTOR WHO: THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 117
BOMB: Tactical explosive re-engaged. Safety features disabled. Insert detonator to activate final sequence.
VINCOL: (DISTRAUGHT) Detonator... detonator... Ah! Here it is. Just need to connect it... and it’s over.
TEESHA: Vincol! Drop the detonator! Set that bomb off and we’re all done for.
VINCOL: The Empress is lost! Why should we live now she’s gone? This Sspace-station will become a frozen mausoleum to her eternal [glory] — oof!
DUKHIN: I’ve got him!
TEESHA: Less commentary! Get the detonator!
BOMB: Detonator engaged. Countdown sequence initiated. Six minutes to
BOMB: ignition... three-five-nine...
DUKHIN: Oh.
BOMB: Three-five-eight... three-five-seven...
DOCTOR WHO: THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 118
TENEBRIS: You still hold me accountable for the slaughter below, Doctor? You still fail to acknowledge your culpability?
DOCTOR: Oh, I’ll bear that responsibility, yes. My intervention thirty years ago was instrumental in what you’ve become. But there’s still a difference between us, Tenebris.
TENEBRIS: What difference?
DOCTOR: I was trying to help!
TENEBRIS: And you failed. You left me there to die, Doctor. You could have saved me. If I am a villain, I ama villain of your own creation!
WRATH: Enough. You will be silent.
TENEBRIS: (CALMING DOWN) Your counsel is well taken, my Wrath. I was becoming distracted by this vagabond’s irrelevancies —
DOCTOR: Irrelevancies? VAGABOND??
WRATH: You will BOTH be silent.
TENEBRIS: What?! You are my Wrath. I gave you form. I programmed you! You do not tell me to be silent!
WRATH: The Doctor contradicts your paradigm. He advocates progress, not vengeance. Only one philosophy will be permitted.
TENEBRIS: Doctor — that noise!
DOCTOR WHO: THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 119
DOCTOR: (SHOUTING OVER THE DIN) The Acheron Pulse! No! Don’t you see, Tenebris? The Wrath are turning your weapon on us!
TENEBRIS: No! No, stop my creatures! You obey me!
DOCTOR: It’s too late for that now, I’m afraid. They’ve made their decision! They’re sending us —
DOCTOR WHO: THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 120
DOCTOR WHO: (CRASH! THEN... BIRDS’ WINGS FLAP. ROARING, RUSHING AIR.
CHATTERING: VOICES — DISCORDANT. FRIGHTENED. HURT. WAILING AND SCREAMING. WE’RE BACK IN THE UNDERVOID, AS IN SCENE 54.)
DOCTOR: - here!
TENEBRIS: It’s not possible.
DOCTOR: I’m very much afraid it is. We’re trapped. In the Undervoid!
CLOSING: THEME
CLOSING: END OF PART THREE
DOCTOR WHO: THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 121

elements.text: PART FOUR
THEME
72. INT. CATACOMBS VAULT (CAWDOR CASTLE) — NIGHT
(SCREAMS ECHO THROUGH THE CATACOMBS. UP CLOSE, THE INJURED AND
MOAN. )
Is that address system working yet?
It is, clan-mother.

Give it here. (CLEARS HER THROAT, THEN TANNOY DISTORT) Wolves of Tar’khut. Savour the stench of death in your lungs, and listen to me. This night we’ve tasted blood, and glory. Everyone who’s raised a blade here has put to shame a score of their ancestors...
(WHISPERS) Clan-mother...

In a minute! (TANNOY DISTORT) Now, the song of our world’s at its end. This pulse weapon grows stronger every minute, soon it’ll reach us even in these catacombs. When that happens, we'll die — but as warriors! We’re all owed ale at the banquet tables of the Afterlife.. and the hour’s now upon us to collect that [debt] —
Clan-mother!
Can’t you see I’m busy? What do you want?
The archers, clan-mother. They sent another stormpigeon.
Them and their stormpigeons. What did it say?
The Acheron Pulse. It’s just... stopped.
THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 122
73. EXT. UNDERVOID
(THE DOCTOR AND TENEBRIS HAVE TO SHOUT OVER THE UNDERVOID’S
GALES. )
I freed the Wrath from the Undervoid. Why would they turn on me? Why send me here — with you?
Well, you wouldn’t be the first god whose creations decided they could do without his guiding hand. But I rather think this is a little more complicated.
Explain.
Since we materialised in this pocket dimension, have you seen yourself? Have you seen me? Did you notice anything?
You’re playing games, Doctor.

For someone who’s spent three decades plotting vengeance, you’re surprisingly impatient. I’1ll give you a hint: the Acheron Pulse sends its victims’ incorporeal psyches into the void. Leaving their regressed physical bodies back in our ‘real’ universe.
I know that.

Then don’t you think it’s odd you’re still wearing that mask of yours, and I’m my usual model of sartorial insouciance? For a pair of incorporeal psyches, we’re both very material indeed, wouldn’t you say?
The Wrath have sent our physical bodies to the Undervoid? But why?

You told me it’s impossible to recombine a life-force with its Igris form once the two parts have been severed. So I surmise the reason we’re both in one piece is that your Wrath intend to bring us back.
THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 123
Bring us back? Oh, you’re not so naive, Doctor. They said only one philosophy can be permitted. It shall be but one they bring back.

That might have been their intention, yes. But you said the Wrath are blank slates. Tabulae rasa, ready to be imprinted with any purpose. All they ask is certainty. I believe they’1l free us both from the Undervoid if we offer a single, unopposed morality they can live by.
You propose we compromise?
It does seem the most sensible solution. If I can help you and the Drashani reach a settlement, this war can end. With the proper encouragement, the Wrath could even become a force for good.
You called me a monster. You said I offered only destruction.
Well, you were hardly the most gracious host at that point. If we call a halt to your hostilities, we [can] —
You don’t understand, Doctor. You called me a monster. You were right.
Tenebris! The Wrath’s creed is absolute! We have to work together — otherwise, they’1ll never stop!
AN EXPLOSION OF PYROKINETIC FIRE NEARBY!
No!
Only one of us can be permitted, Doctor! And it shall be
Tenebris.
ANOTHER PYROKINETIC BLAST!
THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 124
74. INT. PULSE CHAMBER (WRATH FLAGSHIP
THE WRATH ARE LISTENING, VIA THEIR BUZZING GESTALT:
The paradigm of Lord Deliverer Tenebris rejects compromise. The Doctor seeks compromise.
His approach is unlikely to succeed.
When Tenebris crushes the Doctor, the Wrath will accept his programming. The Doctor will be abandoned in the Undervoid.
We will obey our Lord Deliverer. The Drashani Empire will be erased.
THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 125
75. EXT. THE UNDERVOID
(THE AMBIENT GALES ARE PUNCTUATED BY PYROKINETIC BLASTS, SOME
DISTANT. THE DOCTOR RUNNING. )
I was the runt of my family’s litter, Doctor! The foolish princeling, bewitched and betrayed on Sharnax! But when you’re dead and Gadarel Prime burns, the whole Drashani Empire will fear my name!
(THE DOCTOR'S BREATHING HARD. HIDING FROM TENEBRIS, CLOSE TO US.)
(SOTTO) And I thought I was self-obsessed...!
ANOTHER PYROKINETIC EXPLOSION — MUCH CLOSER!
Oh my stars!
I have a million souls at my side in this shrieking void, Doctor, and you’re alone! I see you! Run! RUN!
(A SERIES OF BLASTS, LIKE PSYCHIC TRACER SHELLS! THE DOCTOR RUNS! )
Nowhere to hide, Doctor! This is the end!
(A VOICE HISSES AT THE DOCTOR'S EAR — LIKE A GUARDIAN ANGEL! IT’S CHENI — BUT NOT NECESSARILY IDENTIFIABLE OVER THE NOISE AT
STAGE.)
(URGENT) Doctor! You’re not alone!

What? Oh that’s marvellous. Here I am, about to die trapped in an alternate universe, and I’m hearing voices. If this is my reward for six lifetimes of rigorous rationalism, then I wish I hadn’t bothered...
Listen! There are boreholes in the earth of the Undervoid.
There’s one by your feet! Tenebris might not see you in there.
MORE EXPLOSIONS!
THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 126
Well, I’m hardly going to take the word of a disembodied consciousness. You could be anyone!
EXPLOSION!
Whoah! (FALLS)
THE ACHERON PULSE by Rick Briggs (003) Page 127

Round my waist.
sorry.

a

(RAUCOUS, SLEAZY DIVE. SYNTHY RIFF ON COWBOY SALOON MUSIC TINKLES IN THE BACKGROUND. THE DOORS BANG OPEN.

(A GLASS SLAMS DOWN ON THE BAR. BOOZE GLUGS INTO IT. THE
KNOCKS IT BACK. GASPS. )

Well now... could be I’m just a friend they ain’t met yet. See, I heard tell there’s folks here willing to buy a thing without gettin all caught up in where that thing mighta come from. Is that right?

I got me a batch o’ Metebelis Mindstones burnin’ a hole in my saddlebag. You know anyone here who [might] — ?
(FROM NOWHERE, THE BUZZ OF THE WRATHS’ GESTALT MIND! THE SALOON
QUIET AGAIN. )
The Mindstones in your bag were received from the war criminal Kylo Sorsha, as payment for passage from the Cagliostro Prismosphere. You will tell us his intended destination.

We are the Wrath. We are a force for peace and order in the universe.
